loans.name: Erika Estefania

texts.es: Estefania vive con su abuelita ya que sus padres por motivos de trabajo viven muy lejos de Estefania. Ella es una joven muy estudiosa, ya que termino la secundaria y aspira poder ingresar a la universidad. Estefania para obtener algo de recursos economicos se dedica a la venta de productos de visuteria, cosmeticos, cremas corporaley y mas productos de revista. Estefania solicita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de cosmeticos y los demas productos que comercializ y asi mejorar su negocio. Estefania tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos y poder ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Estefania lives with her grandmother because her parents live a long way away from her because of their work.

She is a very studious young girl; she has recently finished secondary school and she is hoping to start university.

In order to finance this, she sells jewellery products, cosmetics, body creams and other similar things.

She is asking for a loan so she can invest in cosmetics and other products which she can sell to improve her business.

She dreams of improving her business and generating more income so she can start university.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Bisharifa

texts.en:
Bisharifa is a cheerful young woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is living in village with her family. She is single and lives with her parents. 

After graduation from high school she entered university. She studies at the Arabian-English faculty. She is interested in getting higher education and becoming a specialist in this field. 

She is a responsible, honest and helpful person. After classes at free time she helps her mother in the household. 

She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to pay her higher education costs. She is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
This is Fredrick, a farmer in Kisumu county. 

He keeps cows and breeds chicken. He works on a small piece of land and always looks for ways to improve his farm. He takes part in farming education by the county government. 

He wants to increase his output from his cow and chickens by giving them high-quality feeds apart from what he grows in his farm. The increased output will help him improve the livelihood of his family. With a Kiva loan, he will be able to buy quality feeds for his cow and chickens.

loans.use: to buy high-quality animal feeds.

loans.name: Masouda

texts.en:
Masouda is a 45-year-old woman from Minia. She is married to a part-time farmer and has three daughters and one son. Her husband's income is very low and can't cover the family's monthly expenses.  

Masouda started a poultry project to help her husband with the family income, with 1,000 EGP in capital. Now, she wishes to expand her project and increase her income for her family, so she requested a 2,000 EGP loan to buy more poultry such as ducks and chickens.

loans.use: To buy more poultry such as ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women’s jeans wholesale in order to open a clothing store and improve her offerings.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.en:
Candelario, from Antequera, Bohol, is married and has three children.

He operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transport service. He earns a living by transporting passengers from one barrio to the other. To have supplemental income, he also engages in a food-vending business. He sells snack foods to the locals in his place.

He is asking for a loan to buy fuel and ingredients for food vending, like flour, sugar and edible oil. These will boost his livelihood. Thus, he will be able to continue his motorcycle transport service and also prepare more snack food to sell. In this way, his income will increase and he will be able to provide the needs of his growing children.

In the future, he dreams to expand both sources of income to support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 51-year-old widowed woman who lives with her son in Alipurduar, West Bengal. She lost her husband several years back. She works hard for her family and always supports her son. 

Asha’s son is an electrician by profession. He installs and maintains electrical equipment. He repairs electrical appliances and specializes in the electrical wiring of buildings. He has to face tough competition in the market, as there are other electricians also, but his goodwill and fine work helps him to attain many customers. Now he needs to develop his business to attract more customers. 

As a responsible mother, Asha applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use this money to increase her son's business through purchasing many kinds of modern electronic accessories and electrical goods like wires, a drilling machine, bulbs, etc., in order to serve more customers. 

Asha expects that this loan will help her son to expand his business and will strengthen the economic condition of her family. Asha and her son are grateful to their generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase modern electronic accessories and electrical goods for her son's business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es un productor que vive en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua, donde la principal actividad económica es la producción de café. En su pequeña finca de 3.85 hectáreas, este productor ha establecido 2 hectáreas de café en la cual ha logrado cosechar 80 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo.

Para este año, este pequeño productor requiere un financiamiento para adquirir los insumos y fertilizantes que permitan la nutrición de las plantas, y lograr así una mayor productividad. Su objetivo en los próximos años, es ir estableciendo otras áreas de café en su pequeña finca, ya que considera que este es un rubro rentable, que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a coffee producer who lives in a rural community in Nicaragua. Here, the principal economic activity is the production of coffee.

On his small plot of land which measures 3.85 hectares, he has dedicated two hectares to the cultivation of coffee. He has been able to harvest 80 quintals of parchment coffee in the last cycle.

This year, the small producer needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers which will allow him to feed his plants and, as a result, increase productivity.

His objective for the next few years is to dedicate more area on his plot to growing coffee. This is because he considers this a very profitable business, which allows him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies so he has a better coffee harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth and supplies.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando es un hombre de 38 años de edad, él está muy agradecido por el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello él pudo comprar sus productos para su tienda, y ahora su tienda ya cuenta con más productos y ha mejorado sus ingresos. Rolando ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos como arroz, frijol, azúcar, juegos, golosinas.
El gran sueño de Ronaldo es poder conseguir el crédito para mejorar su tienda y con ello mejorar sus ingresos para construir su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Rolando is a 38 year old man. He is very grateful for the last loan as thanks to it he could buy products for his store and now his store has more products and he has improved his income. Rolando now is requesting a loan to be able to buy more products like rice, beans, sugar, toys and sweets. Rolando's big dream is to be able to get the loan to improve his store and doing so improve his income so he can construct a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries like rice, beans, sugar, toys and sweets.

loans.name: Ajitan

texts.en:
Ajitan is a young entrepreneur and mother of three sons. She is 28 years old and married to Samsil, who is a house painter. Ajitan is illiterate, and she can sign her name only. Their elder son is a carpenter and the other two sons are students. They live in the small village of Raichenga in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar, in their own house.

Ajitan's husband earns for the family by painting houses in their village and in other villages. The availability of work is very irregular, so his income is too small to maintain all the necessities of their family. For earning additional income, Ajitan is engaged in a business of supplying raw materials for ply to different plywood mills and shops. Ply is a layer of a folded or laminated material used in making plywood and wood furniture. She collects wood logs from their village and neighboring villages and cuts them into pieces to make ply supplies for different carpenters' shops and to the traders of wood. 

Now she has decided to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials. For that she needs some capital. Ajitan has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more wood in bulk to be able to supply more. The loan will help her work become more effective and efficient, and therefore, improve her services, which will continue to help her family and give them everything they need.

Ajitan hopes to generate more income and secure a better life from this business. She wants to purchase a mini truck in the future to carry their goods to the market. She appreciates and thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials and wood for the plywood business.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir lives in Brnakot village of the Syunik region in Armenia with his wife and two young children. He is a construction worker with four years of experience in the field. Vladimir is the only breadwinner in their family, as the children are young and his wife has to take care of them. Vladimir has applied for this loan to purchase a compressor that he needs for doing construction work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Vladimir hopes to receive lenders' support and continue providing construction services to his clients with new and better tools.

loans.use: to pay for a compressor needed for construction work.

loans.name: Chigwirizano Group

texts.en:
Ireen thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to purchase different products for her shop. She used the profits gained to start building a house for her family members.

Ireen is requesting another loan in order to buy accessories that are currently not in stock, such as televisions and decoders. She has plans of sending her children to better schools and hopes to eventually reduce her family's levels of poverty.

loans.use: to buy electronic accessories.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from Kapan town. He lives with his mother, who is a teacher working at a local secondary school. 

Edgar himself works in one of the local companies as a distributor. Because the salary he gets is not enough for covering living costs, Edgar also drives a taxi after work. Using his own car, Edgar drives through the night to gather enough income for his mother's living.
 
He applied for this loan to be able to renovate the car and bring it to working condition again. Edgar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car to provide taxi services and earn income for the family

loans.name: Arisi

texts.en:
Arisi is 48 years old. He is married with seven children. He has had a farming business for eight years. He will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to help grow more cash crops to sell. He hopes this will enable him to educate his children, buy more farm inputs and also provide for the basic needs of his family. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his farming by growing more cash crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and manure to grow more cash crops to sell to enable him to educate his children and also buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Qorichaska Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHASKA DEL CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anacris ella es conviviente y tiene 27 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de bazar, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “QORICHASKA DEL CUSCO” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Anacris is one of the members. She is 27 years old and, is in a common-law relationship and has one child. She works in her business of selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses and shirts, She is an enterprising woman and a fighter who through her business wants to get her family ahead. She has been in this business for a number of years and things are going very well. Her dream is to have a store. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, shirts and blouses.

The member who has their photo attached to the group photo had her picture taken after the meeting as she had permission to be late due to her work. The other members work in a stationary store, selling clothing, a grocery store and an internet business.

Anacris thanks all those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is married with three children. He describes himself to be obedient. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for five years providing service to the local community. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial insecurity. He will use the 70,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su finca de 6 manzanas, de las cuales 2 son de café. En el último año su producción de café fue de 80 quintales pergamino. 

La visión de este productor, es incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café, mediante el mejoramiento nutricional de sus cafetos y un adecuado mantenimiento. Para lograrlo, este ciclo se ha propuesto enfrentar los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que afectan este rubro, mediante la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal, y para ello está solicitando un financiamiento.

Él está seguro que con la disposición de recursos, su trabajo y el acompañamiento técnico que le brinda la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), podrá alcanzar sus metas, que le permitirán tener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is a small coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and three children on his farm which is approximately 10-1/2 acres of which about 3-1/2 are coffee. His coffee harvest last year was 80 quintals pergamino [coffee dried with the parchment skin not hulled]. 

The vision of this farmer is to increase the productive yield of his coffee farm by nutritional improvements of his coffee trees and adequate maintenance. In order to achieve this he has proposed with this cycle to face the pest and disease problems that affect this field by the application of inputs and fertilizers that his coffee trees need and to do this he is asking for a loan.

He is sure with the availability of resources and the technical support from Pueblos in Acción Comunitaria (PAC) he will be able to achieve his goals permitting him to make more income for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to his coffee trees in order to have a better crop

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 41 years old and resides in Falakata in Alipurduar district. Her husband is a farmer and very much dedicated to his work in the fields. They have two sons; their elder son works for a private company on a daily-wage basis and the other is a student. Chanda is a housewife who also helps her husband in agricultural activities.

Through the years, planting and cultivating vegetables and fruits has been the way in which her family has earned a living. This work has supported them and has allowed them to move forward. In her youth, Chanda had no opportunity to attend school due to her parent’s poor economic situation. For this reason, she started to work at domestic tasks as well as cultivation work. 

The land that her family works is their own and is located a few kilometers from their house. The only challenge they face is the increase of the price of agricultural inputs like seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. Now, as they want to cultivate cucumber in bulk quantities, they need money to purchase these. 

Chanda requests financial support from BJS and Kiva for the purchase of agricultural inputs to give her cucumber cultivation better and appropriate assistance. She hopes the loan will fulfill her purpose. She wants to purchase more agricultural land from the profit. She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: This is Lawrence from Kisumu county. He farms sugarcane, bananas, poultry, dairy and fish. He loves farming and believes it adds color to life and that everyone must eat. He sells his produce in the local market and the milk in the co-operatives, and this gives him an income to take care of his family. He encourages his neighboring farmers to have a variety of farm produce to cater to the different markets. He wants to increase productivity in his farm by adding fertilizers, dairy feed for his cow and pesticides for his produce. With a Kiva loan he will be able to purchase the fertilizers, dairy feed and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilzers, dairy feed and pesticides

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 44 years old, married, and has one adult child. She lives in Nojikhevi. The only source of income for family is from agricultural activity. Nadia and her husband are engaged in cattle and cow breeding and cultivating family-owned agricultural land, where they harvest maize and nuts. The couple earns an income from selling agricultural products at the local market. 

Nadia sought credit among local financial institutions to start an additional and stable business, but her attempts was unsuccessful because of not having enough income. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. With the loan, Nadia will purchase stocks of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell in her community, even door-to-door to make sales.
 
Nadia is a very motivated and hard-working woman with a great desire to ensure her family members have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Sisian town and lives with his grandmother. Artur's father left the country with the hope of finding a good-paying job and supporting his family. Artur's only sister is married and lives separately with her family. As the main breadwinner of his family, Artur started to work in construction three years ago. He receives different orders from local people in Sisian town, and provides reconstruction and home repair work.
 
This loan is important for Artur to purchase tools needed for providing construction services. He currently uses old tools that are partially damaged and very difficult to use. Getting the loan to buy new tools is very important for him.
 
Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for providing construction services

loans.name: Carmen Ernesto

texts.es:
Carmen Ernesto es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa en su finca de 3.5 manzanas de las cuales 0.7 son de café. En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 30 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo.

Para mejorar el rendimiento y la calidad de su producción en el manejo post-cosecha, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la construcción de un beneficio que le permita contar con las condiciones necesarias para el manejo adecuado de su cosecha, y con ello incrementar los ingresos.

La meta de este pequeño emprendedor, es contar una finca productiva  y sostenible, que pueda heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernesto Carmen is a small coffee producer in a community in Jinotega, a department of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife on his plantation of 3.5 blocks, 0.7 of which are for coffee. In recent years, this producer has achieved a harvest of about 30 quintals of coffee in its outer husk, which produces under the fair trade certification criteria.
To improve the yield and quality of his production during post-harvest handling, he is requesting a loan for the construction of a processing plant that allows the conditions necessary for the proper handling of his harvest, and thereby increase revenues.
The goal of this small entrepreneur is to have a productive and sustainable plantation that his children can inherit.

loans.use: To build a coffee processing plant with a humidity level that allows him to achieve better quality with his harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy feed for his dairy cows and be able to get more milk to sell and hopes this will enable him to generate more income and educate his children.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a math teacher living in Mayisyan village of the Shirak region. Emma is a mother of two children and her husband is a migrant worker. Emma's daughter is a musician playing in a symphonic orchestra and her son helps Emma with agricultural work. Emma is a proud mother who does her best to sustain her family's living. 

Emma is involved in agriculture. Emma and her son keep two cows, calves, 12 sheep, and 85 hens. They also cultivate wheat, potato, and cabbage which is used both for family use and also for selling. Emma has applied for this loan to ask for financial support to purchase seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. 

She wants to enlarge her land cultivation to earn more income for her family. Because the region where Emma's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Emma's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es un hombre de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y trabaja como chofer.
Él es emprendedor, dedicado a su trabajo, amable, atento, responsable y mu trabajador. Su labor la desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; área rural caracterizada por situarse en la región del valle alto, de clima soleado y cálido a una distancia de 13 kilómetros de la ciudad.
Ismael es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de comida, viven en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que se encuentra sin finalizar y cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su trabajo es el de chofer de taxi. La zona donde vive es un área rural cercana a la ciudad, los pobladores del lugar extraían agua de pozos o la recogían del río, actualmente las aguas del río ya no sirven para consumo, “hemos estamos bebiendo agua de pozo durante años, y deseamos concluir la construcción para vivir en condiciones saludables…” comenta. La ventaja de su vivienda es que se encuentra cercana a las recientes conexiones de agua, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para concluir su conexión de agua potable. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa. Él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable para su baño, cocina y lavandería; y dejar de usar su pozo, para brindarle a su familia mayor comodidad y mejores condiciones de salud. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que está construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Ismael solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Ismael, 24, lives with his spouse, doesn’t have children, and works as a driver.
He is business-minded, dedicated to his work, affable, ready to help, responsible and very hard-working. He works in Sacaba, a rural area in the high valleys, where the climate is sunny and warm, some 13 kilometres from the city.
Ismael has brown skin, brown eyes, a short stature, short black hair, and is of medium build. His mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken locally; he learned Spanish by hearing people speak it and by speaking with his customers. He shares his life with his partner, who sells food. They live in a house made of brick and cement that is not quite finished yet. They have electricity and well water, the latter extracted with a pump. Ismael is a taxi driver. He lives in a rural area close to the city. People in this locality have wells and they used to get fresh water from the river as well. However, the water from the river is not fit for human consumption anymore, so the people have been relying exclusively on wells for years. Ismael wants to connect to the city's water grid so as to improve sanitary conditions at his house. Though Ismael's house is located conveniently closed to recently-built municipal water pipes, he lacks the funds needed to connect to the grid. His dream is to finish building his house. He wants to have running potable water in the bathroom, in the kitchen, and in the washroom. He longs to be rid of the well so that his family can enjoy modern amenities and a better standard of living. Ismael has been building his house for three years and this is his second loan with the field partner.
Thus, Ismael asks for a loan to have running potable water in the kitchen, in the bathroom, and in the washroom. His goal is to provide his family with healthier living conditions.

loans.use: to install running potable water in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell and increase her income which will help her educate her children and add more stock.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Gyumri town where he lives with his mother and wife. 

Arman owns a small garage where he has been providing auto repair service since 2013. He provides auto repair work and also trades with spare parts. Arman perfectly manages to provide his family with normal living conditions and does his best to sustain their living. The only thing Arman now needs is some financial support to invest in his business. He asks lenders for this loan to purchase a damaged car, renovate it, and sell its spare parts. 

Arman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Arman hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a damaged car, renovate it, and sell spare parts.

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Ileana es una mujer de treinta y siete años de edad, muy trabajadora y honesta, ella descubrió que su pasión es la venta de ropa, cosméticos y accesorios, por eso inicio a ofrecer estos productos de forma ambulante. Esta carismática mujer, esta muy agradecida porque antes Kiva y MiCrédito depositaron en ella confianza y le otorgaron un préstamo con el que pudo crecer como comerciante notablemente.
En estos momentos los clientes están demandando nuevos productos, es por eso que Ileana vuelve a recurrir a Kiva junto a MiCredito, solicitando un préstamo que le dé la oportunidad de surtirse con nuevos productos y comprar camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, toallas, sabanas, entre otros, ella piensa aprovechar la temporada porque en este mes se encuentra el día de la mamá y todos están buscando obsequios, en un futuro pretende poner una tienda en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Ileana, 37, is very honest and hard-working. She discovered her passion lay in selling clothes, cosmetics, and accessories, which is why she started selling these products door-to-door. This charismatic woman is very grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for trusting her and granting her a loan that helped her grow considerably as a saleswoman.
Customers are asking for more products, which is why Ileana asks Kiva and MiCrédito for a new loan, in order to buy new products, including shirts, trousers, undergarments, towels, and bed sheets. She wants to take advantage of the season, since Mother's Day is this month and everyone is looking for a gift. Her aim is to set up a small shop at her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc -Mototaxistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC -MOTOTAXISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es soltera y tiene 44 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to communal bank 'Sr de Torrechayoc - Mototaxistas'. This bank is situated in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, department of Cusco.
Teresa, 44, is single and has seven children. She has a grocery shop, where she sells first-necessity items such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She works from 8 am to 7 pm and her shop has prospered for many years. Her dream is to expand her shop. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.
The members of the group whose pictures are at the bottom were not able to attend the group photo session because they had to be at work, so their pictures were taken afterwards and added to the main one.
Other members of the group are farmers, clothes sellers, grocery shop owners, or taxi drivers.
Teresa is grateful to all who form part of this dream through these means, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk is 23 years old and he lives with his nice wife and his brother in the frontier village of Gandzakar of Tavush region. His parents are in the Russian Federation and from there they work and send money for their children and their needs. After his schooling, Hayk started farming and still he is busy only with farming in which his brother greatly helps him. Particularly he is interested in swine breeding. Now in his farm he has pigs and piglets and also chickens. He sells pork, poultry, and eggs right from his farm to his regular customers from the city. Hayk also has a hayfield and a nice orchard full of apple, apricot, and persimmon trees that he sells wholesale. Hayk asks for this loan as he wants to develop his swine breeding; he will buy several piglets and also fodder for his farm pigs.

loans.use: to develop his swine breeding including buying several piglets and also fodder for his farm pigs.

loans.name: Ze's Group

texts.fr: Ze qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, portant un boubou vert, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bini au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Ze, âgé de 67 ans, est le père de 12 enfants âgés de 13 à 31 ans, dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Ze à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 52 ans. Ze cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de semence de qualité. Ze entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Ze effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Ze cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Ze planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage  et d'acheter du matériel agricole  . Enfin Ze espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ze is seen in the photo, on the left in the back row, wearing a green boubou (traditional clothing).  He is a member of a group of sixteen farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro. The group all live and work in the village of Bini, south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

Ze is 67 years old and father to twelve children, aged between thirteen and thirty-one years old.  Seven of his children currently attend school. Ze has been working in agriculture for fifty-two years, following other members of his family.  He grows peanuts, maize, sorghum and vegetables on his land, and has to cope with a lack of good quality seed and fertilizer.

This will be Ze's first year working with myAgro to buy good quality seed and fertilizer. This year, he is buying hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize on his one hectare of land. He grows maize because it is a valuable food for families and a good product to sell at market.

Ze will use his increased yield and earnings to buy agricultural material and raise livestock. He also hopes to be able to pay for marriage costs for his children and provide enough food for his family.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de ahora 30 años, él cuenta que está muy agradecido por los créditos a los que ha tenido la oportunidad de tener acceso, pues gracias a ello ha logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y de su pequeño negocio, porque logro comprar sus máquinas de coser y sus materiales. Francisco ahora está solicitando un nuevo préstamo en ADICLA porque lo atienden  rápido y con amabilidad, y porque él tiene la necesidad de comprar materiales como tela, hilos y agujas para seguir elaborando pantalones.
El gran sueño de Francisco es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco, now 30, is very grateful for the loans he was granted, since they helped him improve his family's standard of living. His business is also much better off thanks to the sewing machines and supplies that he was able to buy. Francisco is now asking ADICLA for a new loan, since the institution answers customers quickly and amicably. He needs to buy supplies such as cloth, thread, and needles in order to keep making trousers.
Francisco's great dream is to build a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Sirantou's Group

texts.fr: Sirantou qui se trouve sur la photo assise juste  devant au milieu et portant un  foulard blanc, est membre d’un groupe de 21 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bini au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sirantou, âgée de 53 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 14 à 26 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Sirantou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Sirantou cultive l'arachide,le mil, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et de main d'œuvre. Sirantou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Sirantou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Sirantou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Sirantou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée . Enfin Sirantou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Sirantou is seen in the photo, sitting in the middle of the front row, wearing a white scarf.  She is a member of a group of twenty-one farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro. The group all live and work in the village of Bini, south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

Sirantou is 53 years old and mother to seven children, aged between fourteen and twenty-six years old.  Two of her children currently attend school. Sirantou has been working in agriculture for forty years, following other members of her family.  She grows peanuts, millet and vegetables on her land, and has to cope with a lack of agricultural supplies, good quality fertilizer and labour.

This will be Sirantou's first year working with myAgro to buy good quality seed and fertilizer, and increase her harvest. This year, she is buying seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of peanuts on her 0.0625 hectare of land. She grows peanuts because they are a valuable food for families (often prepared as a sauce), and a good product to sell at market.

Sirantou will use her increased yield and earnings to begin raising livestock and increase her growing area.  She also hopes to be able to pay for schooling for her children and provide enough food for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Bytou's Group

texts.fr: Bytou qui se trouve sur la photo allant vers la droite avec le sac de n'gasene et souriante en troisième position sur le banc, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dialakoroba au sud de Bamako au Mali. Bytou, âgée de 41 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 22 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Bytou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Bytou cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le riz, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Bytou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Bytou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Bytou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Bytou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Bytou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Bytou is seen smiling in the photo, sitting in the middle of the back row.  She is a member of a group of seven farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro. The group all live and work in the village of Dialakoroba, south of Bamako, in Mali.

Bytou is 41 years old and mother to seven children, aged between one and twenty-two years old.  Three of her children currently attend school. Bytou has been working in agriculture for twenty years, following other members of her family.  She grows peanuts, sorghum, rice and vegetables on her land, and has to cope with a lack of rain, agricultural supplies and good quality fertilizer.

This will be Bytou's first year working with myAgro to buy good quality seed and fertilizer, and increase her harvest. This year, she is buying seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of peanuts on her 0.0625 hectare of land. She grows peanuts because they are a valuable food for families (often prepared as a sauce), and a good product to sell at market.

Bytou will use her increased yield and earnings to move into commerce as well. She also hopes to be able to pay for schooling for her children and provide enough food for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Mamou's Group

texts.fr: Mamou qui se trouve sur la photo assignant à gauche son bras sur l'autre femme, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dialakoroba au sud de Bamako au Mali. Mamou, âgée de 47 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 9 à 30 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Mamou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 25 ans. Mamou cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraîchage, le niébé sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Mamou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Mamou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Mamou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Mamou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Mamou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Mamou is seen in the photo, sitting on the far left of the front row.  She is a member of a group of eight farmers who work with the field partner, myAgro. The group all live and work in the village of Dialakoroba, south of Bamako, in Mali.

Mamou is 47 years old and mother to eight children, aged between nine and thirty years old.  Five of her children currently attend school. Mamou has been working in agriculture for twenty-five years, following other members of her family.  She grows peanuts, rice, cowpeas and vegetables on her land, and has to cope with a lack of rain, agricultural supplies and good quality fertilizer.

This will be Mamou's first year working with myAgro to buy good quality seed and fertilizer, and increase her harvest. This year, she is buying seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of peanuts on her 0.0625 hectare of land. She grows peanuts because they are a valuable food for families (often prepared as a sauce), and a good product to sell at market.

Mamou will use her increased yield and earnings to begin raising livestock and trade. She also hopes to be able to pay for schooling for her children and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Southern Ghour. Dina sells food supplies and general products, which she has been doing for many years. 

Dina would like to expand her business but she lacks liquidity. She requested a loan, which she will use to increase the number of products and introduce new products. This loan will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to increase the number of products and introduce new products

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Jitpur is a small village in Alipurduar. Most of the residents of this village are poor. This village is surrounded by hills, which are a blessing for the villagers to earn their livelihood. Saraswati is an inhabitant of this village. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and one son.

Saraswati's husband runs a roadside tea stall, and her son sells lottery tickets. The main source of income for the family is Saraswati’s responsibility. She cuts the boulders from the hills into small pieces of stone and sells them to the builders and to the contractors for construction of roads and buildings to earn their livelihood. She had to hire laborers for the cutting purpose and pay them the labor wages.

The stones prepared from the stone boulders are used in the construction of roads, bridges, buildings, and other construction work. In spite of regular earnings, she is not able to improve her living conditions. So, to overcome this situation by expanding the supply of quarry materials, Saraswati took a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).

From this loan amount, she is planning to pay the wages of the laborers and will purchase stone boulders and other materials in bulk for the preparation of stones. She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of improving her business day by day and ensure financial stability for her family.

Saraswati conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the wages of the laborers and enhance her quarry business.

loans.name: Confiance Ii Group

texts.fr:
Aminata est celle qui tient le bélier en main sur la photo
Agée de 40 ans, Aminata est séparée de son mari, vivant dans une commune rurale au mali avec son  enfant scolarisé âgé de 15 ans.
L’activité de Aminata consiste à acheter des béliers et des bœufs et les mettre à l’embouche, les engraissés puis les revendre au comptant au marché public.  Elle exerce ce  métier depuis 3 ans elle s’approvisionne au  marché local, elle souhaite développée cette activité pour  épanouir sa famille  (santé, éducation et nourriture suffisante), l’embouche  lui a permis  de se procurer des animaux, ceux qui la donne de l’espoir pour le bien être de sa famille.
L’argent reçu du RMCR est investi dans l’achat  de béliers maigre.
Aminata est alphabétisée, l’épidémie des animaux lui pose des problèmes parfois. Aminata est motivée et ambitieuses raison pour laquelle elle s’est adhéré à la caisse RMCR pour renforcer son travail d’emboucher .
texts.en:
Aminata is seen in the photo, holding a sheep.  She is 40 years old, separated from her husband, and lives in a rural part of Mali with her 15-year-old child, who currently attends school.  

Aminata buys sheep and cattle, fattens them up, then sells them for cash at the public market.  She has been doing this for three years and buys her livestock from the local market.  She would like to develop her business to improve the standard of living of her family (healthcare, education and good food).  Her business provides her with some hope for the future of her family.  She plans to buy animals in need of fattening up with her loan.  Occasionally she is confronted with disease problems with her animals.

Aminata cannot read or write but she is very motivated and ambitious.  This is why she works with the field partner, RMCR to improve her business.

loans.use: to by sheep and cattle that need fattening up before resale.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has had a cash crop farming business for 9 years. She will be using the loan to purchase farming tools for tilling land as well as fertilizer and seeds and manure and hopes this will help to grow more crops and get more farm produce for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her farming methods, grow more cash crops and make more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm tools, fertilizer and seeds in hopes this will enable her to increase the farm produce to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yacouba's Group

texts.fr: Yacouba qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, tenant le sac de n'gasene en main, est membre d’un groupe de 3 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dialakoroba au sud de Bamako au Mali. Yacouba, âgé de 44 ans, est le père de 12 enfants âgés de 1 à 17 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Yacouba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 26 ans. Yacouba cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le sorgho, le maraichage, le niebe sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Yacouba entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Yacouba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 26 ans que Yacouba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Yacouba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Yacouba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Yacouba is a member of a group comprising three farmers who are registered with myAgro. He's the one holding a N'gasene bag in his hands, in the center of the photograph. He lives and works in Dialakoroba, a village located south of Bamako, Mali.

Yacouba, age 44, is the father of 12 children aged 1 to 17. Five of them currently attend school. His family's farming tradition, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the household, encouraged him to start working in this trade, 26 years ago.

Yacouba grows peanuts, corn, millet, sorghum, black-eyed peas, and vegetables on his land lot. As a farmer, he faces challenges such as shortage of rain, farming tools, and quality fertilizers.

Yacouba is starting his third year with myAgro, and got reenrolled because of the payment system and quality seeds, and farming techniques and training. This years, he will buy one pack of myAgro hybrid seeds, and fertilizer to grow corn, in order to increase the yields of his 1-hectare land lot.  

For 26 years now, Yacouba has been growing corn for its food-producing value, but also for its commercial value, since he sells corn on the market.

Thanks to the increase in yield and revenue, Yacouba plans to diversify his crops and do business. In the end, he hopes to be able to cover the school expenses of his children, and to assure his family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy one pack of hybrid seeds, and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia lives at her own house with her husband and her kids who are adults, already both are going to college. Eusebia's husband works at La Paz city hall and Eusebia is a seamstress; she makes alpaca blankets. 

Eusebia needs a loan to finish the construction of stairs at her house. As you can see in the picture, the place is not safe, an accident could happen so it is important for Eusebia to have a better place to live. She hopes you can help her. She is healthy and she is working.

loans.use: to finish the construction of stairs at her house

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
Damari es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años, y trabaja como peinadora y manicurista.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Mutualista’ que es la región con la mayor tasa de crecimiento económico en los últimos años, representada principalmente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal. De clima sub tropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Damari es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (segunda de la derecha, viste polera ploma y pantalón blanco y cartera marrón). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como comerciante y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de flores, venta de empanadas, confección de sábanas, venta de accesorios femeninos, venta de comida, venta de carne de pollo y panadería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su trabajo es de peinadora y manicurista, que realiza como empleada en un salón de belleza, en horario continuo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de martes a domingo, “inicie mi oficio como ayudante, luego me volví peinadora y ahora soy manicura…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que cuenta con los conocimientos del negocio, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para independizarse y abrir su propio salón de belleza. Su sueño es abrir su propio negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de muebles y equipo de peluquería para abrir su propio negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Damari solicita un préstamo para comprar equipos de peluquería para independizarse y abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Damari is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her life partner. She has two children, ages 2 and 4, and works as a hairdresser and manicurist.  She is a good mother and an enterprising, optimistic, generous, friendly, responsible and very hardworking woman. Her business is in the “Mutualista” area, which is the region with the highest rate of economic growth in the past few years, mainly respresented by its agricultural and forestry production.

Being from a subtropical climate, with a temperature that varies daily between 21-35ºC (70-95ºF), Damari is dark skinned, has brown eyes and long black hair which she wears tied back. She is short and of average build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks among family. She has a general knowledge of Spanish and uses it in her business. (In the photo, she is the second from the right, wearing a grey shirt, white pants, and carrying a brown purse.)

She lives her life together with her life partner who works as a vendor, and with their two children who are not yet of school age. They live in their own room made of brick and cement, with a sheet metal roof and a cement floor. The room has potable water, electricity, and is connected to the sewage system. 

Her dreams of overcoming her hardships led her to lead a bank of people whose businesses include: flower sales, turnover pastry sales, sheet-making, feminine accessory sales, food sales, meat and chicken sales, and a bakery. The group requests loans to improve their businesses. 
She is employed as a hairdresser and manicurist in a beauty salon. Her schedule is from 9 in the morning till 5 in the afternoon from Tuesday to Sunday. She states that she started her job as an assistant and later become a hairdresser and then a manicurist.  The advantage of her job is that she has knowledge of the business, but the disadvantage is the lack of money to become independent and open her own beauty salon. 

Her dream is to open her own business, for which she wants to purchase furniture and hairdressing equipment. This is the first loan cycle with the financial institution in the two years she has been working in the salon. It is for this reason that Damari is requesting a loan to purchase hairdressing equipment to become independent and open her own business.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing equipment to become independent and open her own business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a secondhand car to start providing taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire labor to expand the farm

loans.name: Ine Group

texts.en:
“Every child is your child” has been Paurine`s motto ever since she became a parent. Her love for children was the foundation for establishing a preschool in her local neighborhood. She opened her preschool in 2012 and registered it with the Ministry of Education. She operates the preschool at her home. She is using four rooms in her house as the crèche. Initially she started of with 10 children. Her business has grown tremendously. She now has an enrollment of 55 children.

Paurine and three women from her neighborhood formed INE group so as to teach each other about business and growth in business. The group joined Thrive Microfinance and attended training sessions as a group.  Her leadership qualities led to her being chosen as the chair of the group. She has been supportive and exemplary as a leader. The trainings the group received at Thrive have been an eye opener to her. She is now able to record her business transactions in a professional manner. She requested a loan, which she will use to build a sandpit shade to enhance the play area for her preschool children.

loans.use: to build a sandpit shade

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian comes from a family of six where both his parents are retirees. He has relied on a private sponsor throughout his university years to help cover his tuition costs at Kenya Methodist University. He was also the program coordinator for the Red Cross at his university.

Brian is currently attending Spire's five-week NGO accelerator program to learn and develop key technical and soft skill sets needed to launch his NGO career. However, he is unable to raise funds for the program fees and is requesting a loan, which he will use to help him meet that cost.

In the future, Brian would love to gain experience in the ICT field with the goal of becoming a lead consultant for a prominent tech corporation such as Microsoft.

loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, las socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco. She continues to sell milk to all of her customers, a business she has been running for quite some time and which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. Lucila would like to continue working so she can support her family. 
Lucila is requesting a loan to purchase milk among other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet its repayment requirements.

loans.use: to purchase milk and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja, age 43, lives in the district of Sachkhere with his wife and their two sons. One of his sons receives a small income as a private artisan, and his wife is involved in trading activities. Elguja receives 150 GEL per month serving as a driver on a bus line, but this is not a high enough salary to allow him to attain the financial stability that he hopes to offer his family. He has therefore decided to buy his own vehicle and transport his own clients. 

With this goal in mind, Elguja requested a loan from local financial institutions. After several unsuccessful attempts to receive credit, he applied to MFO Credo, which has a joint initiative with Kiva. They offer a start-up loan program that offers a chance to people who don't have access to local credit products for starting or restarting businesses. 

With his loan funds, Elguja will purchase a second-hand minibus and will start his own enterprise as a bus driver. He will have regular customers and expects a significant increase in his income. 

Elguja relies on the goodwill of his Kiva lenders, and he highly appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand minibus and start his own business as a bus driver

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is from Vinogradovo. She works as a nurse in a local internal medicine clinic. She's been in that position for six years. 

Nadiya is 40. She's been divorced with two sons she's been raising and providing for all by herself. 

Nadiya is seeking an amount of 16,000 Grivnyas to remodel one of her apartment rooms, improving her living conditions as a result. She is planning to plaster and insulate the walls as well as doing the flooring, ceiling, and wiring.

loans.use: to remodel one of her apartment rooms, improving her living conditions as a result

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia Filomena se dedica al negocio de venta de artefactos como televisores, equipos de sonidos y licuadoras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artefactos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar televisores, equipos de sonido y licuadoras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Filomena sells appliances such as televisions, sound systems and blenders and she works from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. She has been in this business for many years and things are going well for her. 

Her dream is to grow her appliance selling business. She is requesting the loan to buy televisions, sound systems, and blenders.

She is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the payments of her debt.

loans.use: to buy televisions, sound systems and blenders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso, who is a 35-year-old, married woman, lives in Tskaltubo district. She has a husband who works as a private artisan and generates approximately GEL 400 monthly. He is the only breadwinner in the family and he finds it hard to satisfy all his family's needs, even the basic ones. 

Eliso has a great desire to add her bit to the family's welfare and also get financial independence. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Eliso’s credit requests were rejected several times since she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

She then received the credit in the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, a startup program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Eliso will rent a place in a good location and also purchase stocks of various kinds of clothing and she will start selling from the local open market. 

Eliso will get the chance to generate her own income and tackle the financial difficulties with her husband. They are awaiting your support and kindness.

loans.use: to rent a place and start selling clothing.

loans.name: Greslyn

texts.en:
Greslyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs for her raising pigs business.

Greslyn has been in this business for 2 years. Greslyn earns more income from food vending.

Greslyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelsa is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelsa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nelsa requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Nelsa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nelsa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to expand her business and keep her children in school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores - Poroy Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES DE POROY, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Alicia continua con su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, leche, azucar, golosinas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con  sus cuotas establecidas, la socia a la vez continua con la crianza de animales menores, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por m motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de huevos.
texts.en:
Alicia, a member, belongs to the “Senor de los Temblores” Communal Bank, which is located in the Department of Cusco.

Alicia continues to operate her business, a grocery store. She is a responsible and enterprising person who still sells different types of products, such as rice, milk, sugar, and sweets, and other things. Alicia is very grateful for the offer of a loan and she promises to comply with her established schedule of payments. Also, she continues to raise small animals, since this helps to advance her family.

Alicia is requesting a loan to buy milk and sugar, among other items, to stock her store.

The remaining members of the bank sell vegetables, fruit, eggs, and prepared meals.

The member who appears in the photo with her face covered does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: purchase milk, sugar and other items for her grocery store

loans.name: 030906100002.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Hải has a retail business selling fruit. She is applying for a loan to purchase fruit to resell. 

Hải is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 030906100002.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hải joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hải has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hải has been involved in this business for 8 years   The main harship that Hải faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hải hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to resell so as to be able to support her children

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet hails in Antequera, Bohol. She weaves and sells native baskets. She is married with four children. Two of her children are still attending school ages 11-13 year old respectively. Aside from basket weaving, she also engages in food vending business. She sells siakoy(a kind of twisted fried donuts coated with caramelized sugar) and puto(rice cake).

She is asking for a loan  to buy materials like wicker (pliable twigs), buri (palm), and ingredients  for food vending, such as flour, sugar and edible oil. Thus, it will enhance her livelihood and be able to improve her income. With these, she could now able to provide her children with nutritious diets and continue to support the education of her children.

She hopes that her small her basket weaving business will be successful and productive in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy materials like wicker (pliable twigs), buri (palm) and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary works and dedicates her time as a church servant. She actively participates in any church activities and supports church projects. For her income, she receives monthly pension and honorarium. 

Recently, she approached Paglaum to access a loan for renovation and painting of a church building. She hopes to pay off her obligation with the cooperative in a timely manner.

loans.use: for renovation and painting of a church building

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a food vending business. 

Ellen dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jenefer has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Jenefer requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jenefer has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jenefer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for five years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 42 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Zenaida has a general store business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Zenaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a home products retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Annie dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of home products to sell.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 36 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. Cathy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory of nipa roofing to sell.

Cathy has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Edzel

texts.en:
Edzel is 45 years old, married with seven children. Two of her children are in school.

Edzel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Edzel has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Edzel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir owns a transportation business, offering transportation services all over the territory of Ukraine. He is a small entrepreneur based in Berdyansk region. He is an experienced businessman working in this sphere for about 15 years.

Vladimir is seeking a loan of 31,000 Grivnyas to repair his vehicle prior to the upcoming summer season, which is always busy for entrepreneurs like himself. 

Summer in Berdyansk region is a tourist season, when many people come to sea resorts to rest and travel. Vladimir wants to be ready for the season and prevent any unwanted breakdowns and problems with his car during the busiest time of the year.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle prior to the upcoming summer season

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Davaakhuu, 55 years old, lives with her husband and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She is one of our most reliable clients who has borrowed many times and made each payment without any delay. 

She together with her husband, runs a vocation training center. She is requesting a loan of 800 USD to buy cooking equipment such as freezer, oven and cooking pot, as the previous ones became out of use. This equipment will be used for young people who want to work as cooks.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment such as a freezer, oven and cooking pot set.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 48 years old and has three sons. She pays rent, and one of her sons is living by himself. As you can see in the picture, her house is very humble.

Marcela is healthy, she has experience, and she is responsible. She is the owner of a vehicle, which she uses as a taxi, but that work is exhausting and very hard for her.

She hopes you can help her because her taxi business is not generating as much income as she had hoped. She is a good cook, and she needs a loan to buy an oven to cook chicken so that she can make more money.

loans.use: to buy an oven to cook chicken
