loans.name: Otono Zona 2 Group

texts.en:
The Department or State of Quiche in the Western Highlands of Guatemala is well known for its beautiful and wide variety of typical clothing, including gorgeous hats. The Quiche artisans also are known for their ceramics, as well as the processing of cotton and wool.

Santa Cruz del Quiche is the location of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Otoño Zona 2”. There are seven extremely hardworking members of the group who are trying to forge a better future for their families and their communities. They are busy every day purchasing, processing and selling traditional textiles, food and tortillas knowing the income helps their families and the economy of the community. The women are grateful to Friendship Bridge for its financial support since they have seen how that support has increased their businesses. 

Twenty-two year-old Marta has a business where she buys and sells traditional clothing at two neighboring towns’ market days. Marta buys typical cortes (skirts), huipiles (blouses), delantales (aprons), and fajas (belts). She then resells the clothing at a profit which is the reason she is requesting a loan. Her dream is to save her money and buy a stall at a local market in Quiche. Marta feels that this will guarantee a better future for her two daughters.

Marta and the other members of “Otoño Zona 2” thank the Kiva investors for their generous support. The support has been instrumental in helping to provide the non-formal education of important subjects the women need - like bookkeeping, customer service, marketing, better money management, as well as women’s and children’s health topics.  “Microcredit Plus” is the name of this win-win program that combines small loans and education. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy typical cortes (skirts), huipiles (blouses), delantales (aprons), and fajas (belts) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional slippers for her business.

loans.name: Peace Sellers Group

texts.en:
Kadie is a 28-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of Peace Sellers solidarity group. Peace Sellers solidarity group has five members -- four women and one man. (see group picture, Kadie sits in the middle)

Nine years ago, Kadie established her food sale business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 10 am to 6 pm.
 
Kadie is entitled to 2,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy cartons of chicken, fish and eggs for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Kadie is a single parent with two children age seven and three who are both school-going children.

In the future, Kadie plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Kadie and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken, fish and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita, 34, is a married woman with five children, of which three are in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlita has a processed food business in the Philippines. Arlita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like eggs, etc..

Arlita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Arlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like eggs, etc.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. Bernadith earns more income from manicure service.

Bernadith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 39 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries.

Elma has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 49 years old now.

Erlinda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is a 44-year-old married man from the village of Pirveli Khorga. He has three children, a wife and a pensioner mother. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Elguja was unable to study a professional career. He gets income from cattle breeding and tries to satisfy his family's increased needs. However, the family is too large for the income to be enough for them. He has a great desire to start a profitable family business and make better living conditions for his children for progressing in life.

Elguja sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 5,000 GEL for purchasing stock of used clothing. Elguja and his wife will start selling various kinds of clothing with price mark-ups and will get some profit from it.

They rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful, as their income will significantly increase and Elguja will make a better style of life for his children.

loans.use: to make a family business and start trading in used clothing.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Natalya is from Pavlograd. She is 48 and married, with a grown daughter. 

She works as a private entrepreneur in the central marketplace of her hometown. She sells women's clothing merchandise. Natalya owns her vending location. She has been working in this sphere of business for over nine years.

Natalya is hoping to give her business a new boost by diversifying assorted inventory she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. She is planning to restock her merchandise with dresses, blouses, and cardigans to sell this upcoming summer season. She needs an additional 33,500 Grivnyas (UAH) for that. 

Radical currency fluctuations have caused instability of wholesale purchase prices, which is why Natalya needed additional funding at this point.

loans.use: to restock her merchandise with dresses, blouses, and cardigans to sell this upcoming summer season

loans.name: Jebaud Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Jebaud Lestari group made their payments on their previous loan. All the members of the group attend a meeting where they share their experiences. They manage the pigs well because they give them nutritious feed and vitamins. They also make voluntary saving and give to the Field Officer to keep  at MUK.

Ni Kadek has had a satisfactory result with her pigs which grow healthy and big. She sold them all to a large buyer. Now she has enough money to renovate her kitchen. She said many thanks to MUK, Kiva and lenders for supporting her business. She plans to take another loan to increase her business.

To increase the population of pigs, the Jebaud Lestari group decided to take another loan from MUK. This loan will be used buy superior or local piglets and feed and also to renovate the cage.

Ni Kadek will use her loan to purchase local piglets for pig barbeque. She will keep the pigs for 3 months until they reach the maximum weight. The price for 1 kg of pig is between 18.000 IDR andl 22.000 IDR depending on the quality of the meat. Ni Kadek hopes that she will earn enough profit for this period. This time she will save all the profit.

loans.use: to purchase local piglets.

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
Janett is 43 years old and is the mother of five children. She is married, but her husband is unemployed right now. He is looking for a job to contribute money to the family income. In the meantime, he is helping her at her business.

Janett sells sport shoes and needs a loan to buy more shoes for her business. She is healthy and responsible, and she is the only one making money in her family, so she needs your support. 

Janett would love to have a bigger stand in the future.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for her business

loans.name: Welita

texts.en: Welita is 60 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has 5 children now at their adult age. Welita has earned her living from a fish vending business for about 18 years already. She is earning approximately PHP 2,000 each month. She's been a member of PMPC for almost 13 years. Welita has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for comfort room repair. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for comfort room repair.

loans.name: Sarik

texts.en:
Sarik, 39 years old, is living in the community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she is employed as a blacksmith and earns, on average an earning of $8.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for five years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions for the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health and welfare of her family

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a goat raising business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling personal care products. 

Alicia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her goats.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her goats

loans.name: Benive

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Benive works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing. Benive is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer for her business.

Benive has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials to her business..

Rosalie has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 48 years old and married with two children.

Geraldine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Geraldine has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from load retailing.

Geraldine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Emmerita

texts.en:
Emmerita is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emmerita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and other groceries.

Emmerita has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and other groceries

loans.name: Sally Leeset

texts.es:
La socia Sally Lesset se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de muebles,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar muebles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Sally Lesset continues to make a living selling furniture. She is an enterprising, hard-working woman who wants to move forward with her family through this business. She is requesting the loan to buy furniture. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a member of Paglaum MPC since 2011. He heard of many benefits of the Cooperative especially on insurance to a farmer like him. He took a loan to pay for land preparation and buy sacks of fertilizers. 

Benjamin hopes to have good rice production so that he can refinance his farming activities.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and buy sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Her name is Josephine, 40, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Eugene, a driver and they have three children of which one is in college, two are in high school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Josephine operates a small variety store. In the Philippines. A general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also makes peanut butter to sell and does manicure and pedicure service to her customers for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 10000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items and pay for the ingredients of peanut butter which she sells at her store. Part of the loan she will buy nail polish and new manicure set to better serve her customers. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Josephine aims to expand her store and give satisfactory service to attract more customers. She strives to hard to give her children a College Education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients of peanut butter and  some grocery items to sell at her small general store and nail polish for her manicure and pedicure service.

loans.name: Rosemyr

texts.en:
Rosemyr is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemyr is 32 years old and has two children still in school.

Rosemyr has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Rosemyr requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials to her business..

Rosemyr has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials to her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. Elma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell.

Elma has been in this business for 14 years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosie has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is aged 40 years. She is married with four children aged between 6 and 13 years; they all go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been in a business for the past five years. Also, her husband is a farmer. The borrower is the one who raising up her hand. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to buy a piece of land for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a 39-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maribeth has a business buying and selling home care products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Maribeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Aminata, separated with two children. Her children are all school-going children.

Aminata belongs to a solidarity group of four women who have come together to complement each other in achieving their individual dreams. “Bendia” is the name of Aminata’s solidarity group. In the group picture, Aminata is sitting on the left and is wearing a white top.

Bendia Group needs a total loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Aminata will receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase additional clothing and soap for her business.

Aminata established her clothing and soap business 12 years ago to ensure that her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Aminata uses profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. She is open for business Monday through Saturday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. every week. Aminata is a hardworking women.

In the future, Aminata plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing and soap for her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old. She is married with four children aged between 6 and 15 years.They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in business for the past six years.  Her husband is also a farmer. Beatrice is a borrower who is raising up her hand and the other one is a seller. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare, to pay for medical insurance, and to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Karumuna

texts.en:
Karumuna, 39, is married with four children aged between three and fourteen years; two of them go to school. For the past six years she has farmed maize. Her husband is a farmer as well.
She is applying for a 1,337,233 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy fertilizer for her maize fields. She will use her profits for the family’s welfare. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 
For this reason farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her maize fields.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 65 years old. She is married with 5 children aged 14 and 26 years. 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in a business for the past 7 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. Rose is a borrower who is raising up her hand, another one is the seller. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a businesswoman from Tambulig. She has made sacrifices and labors a lot for her 5 children. She signed up her membership to access her financial needs. 

She took a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and farm inputs. Margarita hopes to open a display store for her produce.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Maryfel

texts.en:
Maryfel owns and runs a store in Ozamiz. She is a mother of two children who are now of school age. Fortunately, Maryfel's store is located in a populous place where demands of customers are heavy. 

Maryfel sees to it that she has enough supplies of her goods to sell. She accessed a loan to purchase inventories of sugar, milk, canned goods and biscuits. In the future, she hopes to open another store outlet for added income.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of sugar, milk, canned goods and biscuits

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, four of whom in school, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Marilou is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Alfonso Raymundo

texts.es:
Alfonso es un hombre de 26 años d edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 1 y 5 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Alfonso con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, trabaja como jornalero específicamente como picador de hule en una finca cercana de su comunidad, él tiene ya dos años de realizar esta labor.
Alfonso desde hace algún tiempo ha tenido la preocupación de remodelar el piso de su casa, pero a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos no lo ha logrado realizar, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para poder comprar pisos de cerámica y cemento para darle a su casa una mejor apariencia.
El gran sueño de Alfonso es poder ampliar su casa y comprar una motocicleta para poder movilizarse mejor.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 26 years old, married, and has a beautiful family with three children aged between 1 and 5. This humble family lives in a community in Suchitepéquez.

To earn a living and support his family, Alfonso works as a labourer, chopping rubber on a farm near his community. He has done this job for two years now. For some time, Alfonso has been preoccupied with wanting to redo the floor of his home. However, despite his best efforts, he has not managed to do it. This is why he is requesting a loan so that he can buy ceramic flooring and cement to make his house look better.

Alfonso's biggest dream is to extend his home and buy a motorbike so that he can get around more easily.

loans.use: to buy ceramic flooring and cement.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is 45 years old and married with two children. Lelanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lelanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, drinks and other groceries.

Lelanie has been in this business for 6 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell like milk, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Nermilyn

texts.en:
Nermilyn is 27 years old, married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like oil, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Nermilyn has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like oil, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lutchy

texts.en:
Lutchy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lutchy is 45 years old and has three children are still in school.

Lutchy has a auto repair shop business in the Philippines. Lutchy requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and equipment for her business.

Lutchy has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and equipment for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda se sigue deducando al negocio de elaboracion de pan y venta de productos de belleza,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante  a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pan.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,azucar y leche para preparar pan.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda continues to make her living making bread and selling beauty products. She wants to get her family ahead in this way. Her dream is to expand her bread sales business.

She is applying for the loan to buy flour, sugar, and milk to make bread. She is happy for the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and milk to make bread.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en:
Jannette is 27 years old from Bliss Site, Langatian, Zamboanga del Norte. She has many customers in her fishing vending business for 3 years. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. 

She loaned an amount of Php 24,500.00 to buy housing materials and additional capital to purchase more stocks of fish for selling.
Jannette is thankful for the help given by PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio, age 64, is a fish vendor. He has been engaged in this activity for 10 years. He lives in Ozamiz with his family.

Antonio has saved money toward essential repair and renovation of the house in which he lives. He built up this fund because of his desire to provide a decent home for his family. However, he still does not have enough set aside for these renovations. For this reason, he approached Paglaum and requested a loan with which to purchase materials and paints. 

He hopes to concrete his fence as his next project.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials and paints

loans.name: Gina Paola

texts.es: Gina de 20 años, inició su negocio de tienda de víveres en un barrio del municipio de Baranoa, en compañía de su cónyuge quien había administrado negocios de este mismo formato.  En el año 2012 decidieron aperturar su propia tienda y ofrecer la mejor calidad y variedad de productos, proponiéndoles a sus clientes las mejores opciones de compra de la canasta familiar; bebidas lácteas, carnes, verduras, arroz, aceite, legumbres, productos de aseo y demás, a precios asequibles.  Todos los días los habitantes de Baranoa pueden realizar sus compras en el horario de 6 a.m. a 9 p.m.  Gina realiza sus compras de contado a proveedores y graneros, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir su negocio con víveres como arroz, y aceite, también canastas de gaseosas.  Ella considera que esta inversión le permite mantener stock de productos y garantizar abastecimiento por más tiempo.  Su meta a futuro es comprar una casa y un local comercial. Su principal desafío es incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Gina is 20 years old, and began her grocery store business in a district in the municipality of Baranoa, together with her partner who had managed similar businesses in the past. In 2012, they decided to open their own store and offer the best quality and variety of products, providing customers with the best basic household products, such as dairy drinks, meat, vegetables, rice, oil, toiletries and other times at affordable prices.

Every day, the inhabitants of Baranoa can shop there from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. Gina buys in cash from providers and stores, which is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to stock her store with groceries such as rice, oil, and packs of fizzy drinks. She belives that this investment will allow her to keep a stock of products and guarantee a longer supply.

Her aim in the future is to buy a house and commercial premises. Her main challenge is to increase sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries such as rice, oil, and packs of fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Katsalle Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ayuba has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000 per hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Ayuba can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 62 years old and married with four children. Aurora works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Aurora has been in this business for 40 years now. 

In the future, Aurora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Kankalay Group

texts.en:
Aminata is a member of Kankalay solidarity group (see group picture, Aminata sits in the middle). She sells bags--traveling bags, school bags, computer bags and ladies' bags. Aminata has been selling bags for the past two years. She uses the proceeds from her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Aminata and other group members of Kankalay solidarity group are requesting their first loan. She and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Aminata will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase more bags for her business.

Aminata is thirty years old, married and has four children age twelve, eight, four and one. She hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well.

Aminata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase more bags for her business

loans.name: Beryln

texts.en:
Beryln is 23 years old and has one child. She is a married woman.

Beryln is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Beryln has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Khasiyat

texts.ru:
Хасият 37 летняя жительница района Кубадиен. Кубадиен находится на юго-западной части Таджикистана. Хасият на районе проживает вместе тестю, свекровью, мужем и детьми. Она в  родном районе занимается растениеводством. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 2 года. В этой работе ей нравится, то что она может заработать своим честно нажитым трудом.
   На данный момент все сельские жители уже закончили посев урожая, и Хасият не стала исключением. Она закончила посев и сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по той причине она обратилась за кредитом. В будущем у Хасият мечта расширить растениеводство.
texts.en:
Khasiyat is a 37-year-old resident of the Qubadiyon region, which is located in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. She lives there with her children, her husband and his parents. She works in agriculture in her native region, a business she has had for two years. She likes this work as she is able to earn a living with honest work. 

All local residents have now completed their spring planting, and Khasiyat is no exception. She has finished planting and now needs to fertilize the soil in order to receive a good and rich harvest. However, she doesn't have enough money to buy fertilizer, which is why she is looking for a loan. In the future she dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer to improve her soil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in:  sapota fruit, papaya, bananas, strawberries, snacks, dairy products, and cereals, among other items, for her store and fruit drink stand.

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
The group can pay off all the loan on time as they can sell the pigs with a good price. Now, the price for pork is about 23.000 per kilogram. 

Ketut, the head of the group, maintains 10 superior piglets and all are sold. She gained a nett profit 2.000.000 IDR for them. She’s really greatful for that. She has a plan to use the profit to renovate her kitchen and save the remainder. During the last period of loan, she hasn’t had a problem. All the pigs grew well. She said thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.
 
Marga Damai group got a new loan, the number of members 10 and the total loan 15.000.000 IDR. One member resigned from the membership and decided to continue to manage the pigs business with her own money. She had enough profit from the last loan. She was replaced by a new member. Having been successful with maintaining and fattening piglets, Ketut used this period of the loan to purchase four types of local pigs and they will be maintained for 2 months. Remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of a new birth from the sow that she already owns. 

The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about the business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home and also save for the future of her family.

The group also expect a regular visit from a vet, for ease of getting medicines and consulting.

loans.use: to purchase four types of local pigs and to fix the cage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, trousers, shirts etc. for her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion has a hog raising business. She lives in Langitian Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been in her business for less than 5 years and has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years. She loaned an amount of Php 10,500.00 to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins. Concepcion is very grateful to PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 50 years old, widowed and has 3 children and 2 are married already. She been in a sari-sari store business for 8 years already and it is a profitable business for the family because it earns P 2,500.00 a month that helps them in their daily needs of the family. 

She aims to increase her income so she decided to borrowed a loan at GDMPC to buy additional grocery items for sale to increase her store inventory and have more sales so that it will generate more income.

Elsa plan for the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, age 47, operates a motorcycle transport business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for four years, and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Cecilia requested a loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy spare parts and other items for the maintenance of her vehicle and her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other items for the maintenance of her vehicle and her business

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza runs a dry goods business to earn her living. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from selling rice. She is married, and she works hard to support her family. 
 
Monaliza requested a loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more dry-goods products to offer for sale in her stall.

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry-goods products to offer for sale in her stall

loans.name: Ma. Asuncion

texts.en:
Ma. Asuncion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Ma. Asuncion requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more products of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Ma. Asuncion has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mulengera Group

texts.en: Fred is a married man with three children. He is a motorcycle cyclist who started his business five years ago. His challenge is the slippery roads during the rainy season that affect his business. He has been servicing the motorcycle loan and now needs some money to pay tuition for his two children in elementary school. He and the group members appreciate the efforts of Kiva lenders in alleviating poverty out of the poor communities. They are hardworking and honest people.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en: Julio Cesar is 22 years old and has been working selling chicken for a very long time. He started selling with his father and later became independent and opened his own business. He describes himself as a happy person who likes to read, listen to music and spend time with his wife and sons. He is asking for a loan to refurbish and expand his food stall where he sells chicken. He says that his goal is to continue to expand and acquire more clients.

loans.use: To refurbished and expand his food stall.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa earns a living by engaging in a firewood vending business. She buys and sells firewood. Aside from that, she also engages in selling chicken and pork barbecue during the night. She is a 54-year-old married woman with 3 children aged between 12 and 24 years old. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more firewood and additional capital for barbecue vending. These will help improve her earnings and allow her to continue operating her business. She will be able to purchase more supplies for barbecue vending. Because of this, Celsa will be able to provide her children with nutritious meals and better shelter to live.

She dreams that someday, both of her businesses will become successful and that she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and additional capital for barbecue vending

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 69 years old, married with three children.

Edwina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, and other items to sell.

Edwina has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from buying and selling spare parts.

Edwina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, and other items to sell

loans.name: Emecelia

texts.en:
Emecelia is a married woman with thirteen children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emecelia is 54 years old and has two children currently in school.

Emecelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Emecelia has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nuhu A

texts.en: Nuhu A is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Katsalle Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Nuhu A suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Nuhu A now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Snizhanna

texts.en:
Snizhanna lives in Vinogradovo. She is on the maintenance staff for the local department of internal affairs. Snizhanna has been living in an old house that looks pretty bad, which is why she wanted to renovate it and make it look better.

She is planning to stucco the walls of her private house, which is why she needs an additional 10,000 hryvnias to finish this project. Her salary as a janitor is relatively small, which is why at the moment she is only planning to do part of the renovation work on her house with hopefully getting more work done later when she has additional funding available.

loans.use: to stucco the walls of her private house

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y chompas,la socia tambien ahora se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatillas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Erika is still working buying and selling clothing. She sells trousers, blouses and sweaters. Now, she also makes a living selling trainers. Through this business, Erika wants to move forward with her children. Erika is an enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a premises where she can sell clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy trousers, blouses and sweaters.

Erika is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses and sweaters.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 49 years old, resides in Oroquieta, Philippines, and is a widow with four children. She joined PMPC in February of 2011 in order to access the programs and services of said co-op. 

Recently, she's accessing her third loan of 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) for additional working capital for her existing business. She will use the loan to buy a variety of commodities which she is selling in the local community, including a variety of processed meat products. 

In the future, Clarissa hopes to arrange a decent house for all of those in the family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities which she is selling in the local community, including a variety of processed meat products

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married and lives in Dipolog. In order to help the family, she sells rice cakes. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a small sari-sari (convenience) store. 

Juanita became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 4,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. 

She plans to repair their house and live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en:
The Sawe Mutiara Indah group receives their loan with the same loan size. As one of the groups that received the most loans from MUK, the purpose of the group is capable of self in terms of venture capital. They have been able to manage the business well. 

But they still needs a new loan for their businesses because they have a strong will to become successful business women. The loan will be used to improve their businesses by purchasing superior piglets, crops or merchandise for their kiosk.
 
Ayu Ketut, used the loan to buy more merchandise for her kiosk and a glass rack. She has plans to renovate her kiosk. Her husband helps her business by building a new place for the glass rack. With this business, she hopes she can be saving and will renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her kiosk and a glass rack

loans.name: Varin

texts.en:
Varin, age 19, is a university student from the province of Takeo. He is in his second freshman semester and is pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a major in accounting. He is also working as a waiter in a restaurant in the city, making a daily income of $4. His father earns a living as a traditional wedding-song musician, and he earns additional income from selling water. His mother prepares and sells food to the children at a local school.

Varin was able to pay for his first semester, but he is now requesting a loan because he does not have the means to pay his university fees from now through his fourth year. This loan will allow him to earn his Bachelor’s degree, providing him with strong skills with which to build his future. 

He dreams of finding a good job with a decent salary, and to save enough money to help his parents to complete essential repairs and renovations to their house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the second semester of the first year through the fourth year

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La socia Jacinta pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, tortas, gaseosas, pasteles, galletas entre otros en su kiosco escolar, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la ocia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tortas, gaseosas  entre otros.
texts.en:
Jacinta belongs to the communal bank Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco (Cusco's New Dawn). Jacinta continues to make a living from the sale of candy, cakes, sodas, pastries, cookies and other products in her school kiosk. 

Jacinta feels grateful for the loan she has been granted and she is committed to paying back the established repayments. Jacinta is a responsible and hard-working person who wishes to continue in her work and thus continue to provide for her family. She is seeking this loan to buy cakes, sodas and other products.

loans.use: to buy cakes, sodas and other products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rosa continues to work at her grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. Through this business, Rosa wants to get ahead. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is applying for a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. Rosa is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Rennie

texts.en:
Rennie is a market vendor who sells rice. He primarily supports his family doing this type of work. He accessed his capitalization from Paglaum MPC and makes good of his business. Recently, he wants to take advantage of good sales. He wants to restock bags of rice for resale. He applied another loan for his capital needs. 
In the future, Rennie hopes to open another store outlet for his rice store.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice for resale

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en:
Ermilinda is 52 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ermilinda has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Ermilinda would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Adelaida, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue  dedicándose a la venta de golosinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le v a bien gracias  al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar dulces, gallestas, chupetines entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Adelaida belongs to the communal bank “Señor de los Temblores II” in Cusco,Perú.

Adelaida continues to make a living selling sweets, she has been doing so for a decent amount of time and her business is going well thanks to her hard work everyday. 

Adelaida wishes to keep working in this way and to continue using her earnings to support her family. She is seeking this loan to buy sweets, cookies, candy and other products. 

Adelaida is thankful for the offered loan and she is committed to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy sweets, cookies, candy and other products.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Alma is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase more products like body lotion, bags, shoes, perfume, beauty products and other personal care products.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products like body lotion, bags, shoes, perpume, beauty products and other personal care products

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Patrocinia is 61 years old and has two children who are in school.

Patrocinia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Patrocinia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Patrocinia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virginia is 51 years old and has one child in school.

Virginia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Virginia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 52 years old, married with five children.

Antonina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Antonina has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Antonina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 67 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Gleceria has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buy and sell gasoline.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Eda Marie

texts.en:
Eda Marie is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Eda Marie has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bridgette

texts.en:
Bridgette is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children still in school, Bridgette works very hard to provide for them.

Bridgette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, drinks and other groceries to sell.

Bridgette has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Kylah

texts.en:
Kylah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like direct selling Natasha.

Kylah dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 24 years old and single with two children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, breads, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Editha has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, breads, eggs, milk, coffee and etc

loans.name: Sinar Dewi Group

texts.en:
This is the Sinar Dewi group from Pejarakan, Singaraja, which is in the northern part of Bali. All five members of the group raise pigs to earn an income. 

The group members would like to thank their Kiva lenders and MUK for the support they received from their previous loan. Ida Ayu, the leader of the group, purchased superior feed for her pigs with her loan funds, and she sold all her pigs at a profit to a major buyer. She now has two more sows. With her profits, and with the help of this new loan from MUK, she plans to purchase local piglets and feed. With the overall increase in household income, she has better supported the daily needs of her family, and she has started a savings fund for her family's use in the case of emergencies. 

The Sinar Dewi group applied for a second loan, with five members receiving a total loan of 5,000 IDR. Having been successful with her pig business, Ida Ayu will be using most of her portion of the loan to purchase four types of local pigs to raise for two months before making a profit by preparing and selling pork barbeque. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed for her pigs. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about her business going forward. With the increased profits she expects as a result of her loan investment, she plans to make essential repairs and renovations to her home. She will also place money into savings to be utilized as business capital.

loans.use: to purchase four types of local pigs and feed

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is a 50-year-old married father of six children. He lives in a village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Son has been working as a construction worker for 10 years. His wife is 51 years old and is a homemaker. Two of the six children work as construction workers, a married daughter buys and resells beehives, one is a security guard and two are students. Together, the family can earn around $28 per day. 

Son would like to build a house for his married daughter but he doesn’t have enough money to buy lumber and zinc sheets, so he takes out a loan. This loan will help him have enough money to build a house for his daughter. For the last two children, Son is going to help them to earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets to build a house for his married daughter

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia has a mango orchard in Pagadian. She is a mother of two and does farming to earn a living. She has accessed a loan to purchase units of knapsack sprayer for her mango orchard. She wants to have a good harvest this round of crops.

loans.use: to purchase units of knapsack sprayer for her mango orchard

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Primrose

texts.en:
Primrose is 26 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Primrose is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Primrose requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Primrose has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Primrose would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florencia is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Florencia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo, leaves, etc..

Florencia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 35 years old and has three children still in school.

Mary Jane has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 42 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, snack foods, candies, noodles, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, age 51, raises livestock to earn her living. She has operated her agricultural business for 10 years and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have four children, two of whom still attend school.

Lourdes requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and other supplies for raising her livestock.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising her livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 4500 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Agripina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas, polos,blusas y pantalones. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Agripina still works selling clothes. She is a very hardworking woman who, through her business, wants to support her family. Her dream is to have a shop in which to sell clothing. She is requesting the loan to buy sweaters, polo shirts, blouses and trousers.

Agripina is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, polo shirts, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josaphat is a resident in the town of Antequera, Bohol.  She is 33 year old, married, with two children ages 6-13 year old respectively. She  sells mangoes to the local in her location.  Aside from that, she also engages in the preparing and selling of snack foods, like donuts and siakoy( twisted donuts).

She is asking for a loan to buy mangoes and additional ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour and utensils like a frying pan. This will boost Josaphat's income and able sustain her daily source of income. She could now provide her children with good food and better shelter to live.

She hopes to improve both her sources of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy mangoes and additional ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour and utensils like a frying pan

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina se sigue dedicando al negocio de preparacion de bocaditos,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de preparacion de bocaditos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,huevos y mantequilla.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Georgina still works preparing sandwiches. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who wants to move forwards with her family through her business. Her dream is to expand her business preparing sandwiches. She is requesting the loan to buy flour, eggs and butter.

Georgina is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and butter.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn, age 32, operates a sari-sari (general store) business to earn an income. Her husband is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), but Lyn opened her store because she needed extra income with which to sustain her family's needs. 

As a mother, Lyn wants to give her children a better living. To this end, she would like to increase the income she earns from her store. She therefore requested a loan from GDMPC in order to buy additional grocery items to offer for sale. This will allow her to increase her store inventory, facilitate more sales, and generate more income. 
 
Lyn's plan for the future is to expand her business, making it such a success that even if her husband stopped working abroad, they could still provide their children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is a 45 year old woman and a mother to four children. Two of them are aged 11 and 6. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business for nine years now. This is the source of their income together with her husband who is a farmer. 

Benedicta is asking to take a loan to buy cases of beers, liquors and rice. This loan will help them improve their stocks that sell fast. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory and introduce more items to sell to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy cases of beers, liquors and rice

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old and has one child. She is a married woman.

Julieta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 53 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Leonila has been in this business for 8 years now. 

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 56 years old and has three children. Juanita is widowed and has one child in school.

Juanita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Juanita has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Kimsroy

texts.en:
Kimsroy is 58 years old, a married mother with one adult child in her care. She lives in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She has worked as a teacher for over 14 years. Her husband, 52, is a truck driver. She and her husband can earn around $11 per day.

Kimsroy would like to buy construction materials to renovate her house and build fences around it, so she is applying for this loan. With this loan, she will have enough money to build a proper house and achieve better living conditions. In the future, she wants to help her child earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house and build fences around it

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four adult children. She relies on farming to help the needs of her household. She started this livelihood five years ago. Farming is one of the hardest work being exposed to the heat of the sun. But Elinita is a persevering woman.

She is asking a loan to finance her farm. It will be used to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labor. In the future, she plan to expand her farm and to venture unto other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married, 44 years old and has six children, 5 of which are in school. 

Magdalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalina requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Magdalina has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Magdalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Alnie

texts.en:

Alnie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Alnie requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Alnie has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alnie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:

Merlinda requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase fishing netting, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

She would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing netting, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dolly is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bread production business.

Dolly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bread production business

Rosalie has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Jermilyn

texts.en:
