Jermilyn requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs.
 
In the future, Jermilyn would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs

loans.name: Siempre Arriba Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Lleyli Pamela es una joven madre de familia de 26 años de edad, tiene una hija de 7 años. Forma parte del grupo "Siempre Arriba" el cual esta conformado por 8 personas donde todos se dedican a un negocio independiente y con esfuerzo salen adelante.
La Sra. Lleyli Pamela es una joven madre que se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y productos de belleza mas de 4 años, su negocio esta dirigido al publico en general cuenta con una amplia cartera de cliente donde les ofrece sus productos y ella de esa manera obtiene sus ingresos, lo que le gusta de su negocio es que es un trabajo independiente, su mayor sueño es tener un local propio de venta de ropa y de esa manera obtener mas ingresos y seguir creciendo como empresaria.
la Sra. LLeily Pamela se siente contenta y agradecida por el apoyo y la confianza que depositan en ella. El préstamo que le otorgan principalmente es solo para la inversión de ropa y ofrecerles a sus clientes de manera rápida sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Lleyli Pamela is a young mother of 26 who has a seven-year-old daughter. She is a member of the "Siempre Arriba" group, which has eight members who all make a living with independent businesses and move forward through hard work.

Lleyli Pamela is a young mother who has had a business selling clothing and beauty products for over four years. Her business is aimed at the public and she generally has a broad customer base to whom she offers her products. This is how she earns a living. She likes her business because it is an independent job. Her biggest dream is to have premises in which to sell clothing so that she can increase her earnings and continue to grow as a businesswoman.

LLeily Pamela feels happy and grateful for the support and trust placed in her. The loan she is first granted is only to invest in clothing and to offer customers their orders quickly.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
56-year-old Ma. Lourdes raises and sells hogs for a living. She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. She is married woman with one grown child. Her husband is a farmer. She is in need of funds to finance her business.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feeds. These will give Ma. Lourdes' hog raising business will boost. Thus, within few months, she will be raising and selling quality pigs. This will augment her income and she will be able to expand her business.

She is hoping that she will be able to enhance her hog raising business for the improvement of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

Maribeth has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es un joven hombre de 28 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de contaduría pública.
Él es inteligente, feliz, soñador, optimista, emprendedor, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública situada en la ciudad a 65 km. al Sur Este del Lago Titikaka, entre los 3300 y 4100 metros sobre el nivel del mar, es una de las metrópolis más altas del mundo. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-17 grados centígrados.
Edgar es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por las actividades que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan y con sus 2 hermanos menores que estudian y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de contaduría pública y se encuentra en los últimos años, se prepara para; Intervenir en el diseño y evaluación de las funciones de planeamiento, coordinación y control de entidades públicas y privadas, entre otras actitudes. “trabajo y estudio, necesito tramitar mi título profesional…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él trabaja como transportista. La ventaja de sus estudios es que se encuentra en la etapa final, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar los trámites de titulación. Su sueño es ejercer su profesión, él desea pagar los trámites de titulación para obtener su título profesional y ejercer su profesión. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Edgar solicita un préstamo para pagar los trámites para obtener su título profesional y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Edgar is a young man of 28 years of age, he is single, childless, and studies Public Accounting. He is intelligent, happy, a dreamer, optimistic, entrepreneurial, responsible, and very hardworking. He studies at the public university located in the city that is 65 km southeast of Lake Titicaca, which is around 3,300 and 4,100 meters above sea level, and that is one of the highest metropolis in the world. Its climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies between 1 and 17 degrees Celsius during the day.

Edgar is of brown complexion, has brown eyes, short black hair, he is short, and has a thin physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he uses to speak with his family, and speaks Spanish due to the general culture, and the activities he does.

He shares his life with his parents, who still work, and with his 2 younger brothers, who go to school and work. They live in their own house, made out of brick and cement, with a roof made out of calamine, and wooden floors. The house has drinking water, electricity, and sewerage.

He currently studies Public Accounting and is in his last years of his studies. He is preparing for: intervening in the design and evaluation of the functions of planning, coordinating, and control of public and private entities, among other activities. "I work and study, I need to process and get my professional degree..." he comments. In addition to his studies, he works as a carrier.

The advantage of his studies is that he is in the final stages, the disadvantage is the lack of resources to pay for the administrative procedures in order to obtain his certification. His dream is to practice his profession, and therefore he wishes to pay for these procedures.

This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 4 years he has studied and worked. It is for these reasons that Edgar requests a loan so that he may pay for the procedures he needs to cover so that he can obtain his professional degree and practice his profession.

loans.use: to pay for the administrative procedures required to obtain his professional degree, so that he may practice his profession.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền works in agriculture farming food.

Hiền is 60 years old and married with six children.
Hiền lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his business. Hiền has successfully repaid  one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Hiền has been involved in farming for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hiền faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Hiền hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his children, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sayuris

texts.es: Sayuris de 24 años de edad,  decidió independizarse e iniciar su propia vida comercial al ofrecer enseres que le facilitan las labores del hogar y el cuidado personal a las amas de casa o trabajadora. Anteriormente ayudaba al exesposo de su madre en éste negocio, sin embargo consideró que era más conveniente para ella buscar nuevos clientes y ofrecerles electrodomésticos menores como  planchas, abanicos, saducheras, secadores de cabello y también tendidos para camas. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio ubicado en el municipio de Baranoa, a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago.  Sayuris es muy comprometida y responsable con esta actividad por eso todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. ofrece a sus clientes productos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en planchas, sabanas y secadores, considera que al realizar esta inversión podrá exhibirlos y vender más.  Sayuris es madre de un hijo  menor de edad a quien desea ofrecerle mejor calidad de vida, por eso su meta familiar es comprarle una casa y tener un almacén con mucho inventario.
texts.en:
Sayuris is 24 years old. She decided to become independent and begin her own life in business by offering appliances to make housework easier and personal care products to housewives and working women.

Before this, she used to help the ex-husband of her mother in this business. However, she decided that it was better for her to find new customers and offer them small household appliances such as irons, fans, toastie makers, hairdryers and bedsheets. Her main customers are neighbours living in the district of Baranoa, to whom she offers payment facilities. Sayuris is very committed and responsible with this activity. This is why, every day, she offers her customers products from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in irons, sheets and dryers. She belives that by making this investment, she will able to display them and sell more.

Sayuris has one young child, who she wants to offer the best quality of life possible. This is why her family goal is to buy a home and have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to invest in irons, sheets and dryers.

loans.name: Sedana Yoga Group

texts.en:
With her previous loan, Ni Nengah bought three superior piglets and feed. She sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. During the period she raises her pigs, they grow well and avoid disease so she can sell them at a high price. The profit can meet the needs of daily life, educate her children and build capital for her business. Now she can make her dream come true to renovate her kitchen. She’s very grateful to MUK, Kiva and its lenders for supporting her business. She said she can always count on the loan officer from MUK to give advice and offer solutions for her business challenges.

The Sedana Yoga group is borrowing another loan from MUK. The group members feel comfortable with this loan because they have been trained by the MUK staff.. 
After the success of the previous loan, Ni Nengah borrows again to purchase four superior piglets to fatten and sell. Some of the loan will be used to purchase superior feed. The price for one superior piglet is 500.000 IDR. Profit from this business will help support her children's education. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: to purchase four superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach is a 48-year-old widowed pharmacist with a dependent child. She has been in this business for over two years. Her only child works as a factory worker. Both of them reside in a village in the Kandal Province in Cambodia. Mach and her child can earn around $12 per day. 

She lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use, therefore she would like to request a loan. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva .With the motorcycle from the loan, she and her child will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expenses. For her future plans, Mach is going to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work and for family use

The main hardship that Năm faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipments to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Năm hopes for his business to do well, to build a new house and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 40 years old. He is married with two children aged 2 months and 1 year. Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past five years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Siffa

texts.en:
Siffa is aged 37 years. She is married with three children aged between 7 and 12 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in business for the past 7 years. Her husband is a business man. Siffa is the borrower who is raising up her hand, and the man who put on the long jacket is the one who selling the cow. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to buy piece of land for rearing cows on. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Del Hogar Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes, tiene 34 años de edad es una madre de familia con tres hijos y una de ellas se encuentra delicada de salud pero a pesar de las dificultades sale adelante. forma parte del grupo "Las Triunfadoras del Hogar" la cual se siente identificada con el nombre del grupo, este grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes donde todos se dedican a un negocio independiente.
La Sra. Mercedes  a pesar de las dificultades es una mujer que sale adelante con el negocio de venta de comida norteña mas de 5 años en el domicilio, este trabajo le permite darle educación a sus menores hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.El anhelo de la Sra. Mercedes es verlos a sus hijos profesionales pero también tiene un sueño muy grande y es lograr poner un restaurante por su zona que le permita obtener mas ingresos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para desarrollar su negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes, 34 years old, is a mother with three children. One of her children suffers from poor health but, in spite of difficulties, she gets ahead. She is part of the group “Las Triunfadoras del Hogar” (Home Winners) and she identifies with the group's name. This group is made up of five members, all of whom make a living through independent businesses.

Rosa Mercedes has been running her business for more than five years, selling northern food from her home. In spite of difficulties, she is getting ahead and this job allows her to educate her children (who are minors) and have a better quality of life. Rosa Mercedes' wish is for her children to become professionals but she also has a big dream of setting up a restaurant in her area so that she can increase her income.

She will invest the loan in buying supplies to develop her business selling food.

loans.use: to buy supplies for selling food

loans.name: Analo

texts.en:
Analo is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analo is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analo has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Analo requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetable to sell in the market.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Analo has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Analo would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to sell in the market

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta is 36 years old and has three children. Mercideta is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Mercideta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mercideta requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Mercideta has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercideta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherry is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cherry has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like lotion, etc..

Cherry has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like lotion, etc.

loans.name: Quimlie

texts.en:
Quimlie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Quimlie is 31 years old and has one child who is in school.

Quimlie has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Quimlie requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Quimlie has been in this business for 3 years. Quimlie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divina is 40 years old now.

Divina has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Divina has been in this business for 1 year. In the future.  Divina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jo-Ann

texts.en:
Jo-Ann works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines.

Jo-Ann requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lornita

texts.en:
Lornita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lornita is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lornita has a native coffee making business in the Philippines. Lornita requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Lornita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lornita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Dorisa

texts.en:
Dorisa is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dorisa is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Dorisa has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Dorisa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Dorisa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Dorisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Arlina

texts.en:
Arlina is 50 years old and married with four children. Arlina works very hard to provide for them.

Arlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, breads, canned goods, spices, drinks and other personal products care.

Arlina has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, breads, canned goods, spices, drinks and other personal products care

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 50 years old, married with seven children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, breads, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and other personal care products.

Josefa has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josefa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, breads, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and other personal care products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is aged 42 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 17 years and they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 3 years, while her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en:
Evaste is 48 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 4 and 7 years, and 1 of them goes to school. She is a farmer and has been in a business for the past 5 years. She is a widow.

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es:
El socio Anderson se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de maquinarias industriales,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de maquinarias.El socio solicita le credito para comprar una maquinaria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Anderson, continues working in his business selling industrial machinery. The member's dream is to expand his business selling machinery. The member asks for a loan to purchase machinery. 

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase machinery.

loans.name: Yndira

texts.es:
La socia Yndira se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboración de tejidos, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lana de colores y palitos de tejer.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Yndira, continues working in her business making knitted products. The member is a hard-working and determined woman who, through this business, wants to get her family ahead. The member asks for a loan to purchase colored wool and knitting needles.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase colored wool and knitting needles.

loans.name: Mushkiniso

texts.en:
Mushkiniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a village where agriculture is usual. She is married and has one child. She is a cleaning woman in a private school. She has had many years of experience of working at a school. Her husband is a pensioner. Mushkiniso works hard in order to feed the family. 

She wished to improve their standard of living and decided to keep livestock for milk and further selling. 

She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to take a loan to buy livestock. She hopes to have an efficient business to ensure a future for her child and family.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Nohemi Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia Nohemi Rosalia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar yeso, clavos y arena.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Nohemi Rosalia, continues working at her business selling construction materials. The member, through this business, wants to get her family ahead. The member asks for the loan to purchase plaster, nails, and sand.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase plaster, nails and sand.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 34 years old and has five children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Divina is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Divina has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

Divina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is widowed and has a raising pig business in the Philippines.

Emily requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Emily has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 56 years old and married with six children. Estrellita works very hard to provide for them.

Estrellita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Estrellita has been in this business for 27 years. 

In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Her name is Rhodora, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Jimmy, a seaman, and has one child, who is now a college student. She works to augment their income to meet their everyday needs and her daughter's educational needs.

Rhodora operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 25000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to which she sells at her store. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her daughter to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rhodora aims to expand her store and dreams to see her daughter become a professional someday. She prays for God to bless her family with joy and love always for one another. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia, a 40-year-old  married woman with four dependents ranging in age from five to 15 years, lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol. She weaves and sells native baskets as her main source of income. Her husband's income as a carpenter helps meet the family's daily needs. 

Syliva has requested a loan to buy materials such as buri (palm) and wicker (pliable twigs) as well as piglets, the latter because she is starting to raise hogs to  supplement her income. These resources will enable her to better provide for the needs of her growing children. 

Sylvia hopes to become a successful entrepreneur to help improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and weaving materials such as buri (palm) and wicker (pliable twigs)

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Francisca works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Francisca has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha is a 32-year-old mother of two young children and lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Since 2008, she has rented a house near a market to run a beauty and hair salon, earning around USD8 each day. One of her two children is in school. Her husband is 50 years old and he is a solider, earning around USD6 a day. 

Sopha has decided to apply for a loan because she needs finances to buy more cosmetics to sell to customers of her salon. This loan will help her have enough money to buy more cosmetics and improve her business. For her future plans, she hopes to have enough money to buy her own house at the market to run her salon. She also wants to help her children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
Angeli is a 26 years old, married and has one child. She wants to help her husband for a living.  She needs to earn income from a sari-sari store business in providing the needs of her child with the help of her husband, also as a farmer. She needs to increase her income so she needs to buy more goods to  sell to increase her store inventory and be able to generate more income. 

Angeli decided to borrowed a loan at GDMPC to buy the goods.

Angeli wants for the future to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sell.

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Mamani is an energetic and hardworking woman of 33 years. She has a primary education to grade 8. She is the mother of two children who are students in grades 6 and 7. Mamani lives in the small village of Paschim Jitpur in Alipurduar.

Mamani and her husband Jaydip together run a small business of selling clothing, but their inadequate income is insufficient to meet all the family expenses. Mamani always strives to provide her children with all things necessary for daily life. She dreams that her children will receive higher education.

She purchases varieties of saris (a traditional Indian dress) from the wholesale market and sells them in her locality. She sells other clothing also like petticoats, blouses, and ready-made garments as per seasonal demand. She has been working in this business for many years and has a lot of experience in this area of business. Now with the growing demand of her valuable customers, she would like to expand her business. She would like to re-establish her collection of saris. With this aim she requests a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to purchase more variety of saris and women's clothing according to customers' seasonal demands, because in festival seasons she needs more stock to satisfy her customers.

Mamani hopes the expansion of her business will earn more profit to provide her family with good financial sustenance. She wants to get ahead with the business for a secured future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing (mainly saris) to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 28 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Jacqueline works very hard to provide for them.

Jacqueline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Jacqueline has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Jacqueline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Kimberly is 23 years old and has one child in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Kimberly has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Kimberly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia Ofelia  se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar, la socia vende regalos y adornos, la socia es une mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el  credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ofelia continues making a living selling gifts and decorations in a retail shop. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who, through this business, wants to help her family get ahead. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase decorations and stuffed animals. She is happy about the loan and is committed to following through with the payments of her share.

loans.use: to purchase decorations and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 42-year-old lady from Harinathpur. Harinathpur is a very remotely located rural village in the district of Alipurduar in West Bengal.

Most of the people of this village are poor and depend upon cultivation and labor. But some of the people have adopted other sources of income for development of their families. Jayanti is one of them; she rears cows. She lives with her husband and two sons. One of her sons is pursuing his bachelor’s degree, and the other son is unemployed. Her husband is a cycle van puller, but his earning is irregular.

Jayanti, though she does not have a formal education, is a very active woman who wants to raise the financial status of her family. She has been running a dairy farm for many years. She sells milk in her neighborhood. For additional income, she also sells cattle byproducts like cow dung to her customers.

Jayanti has so many dreams, but due to her scanty income she could not even think to fulfill these. Therefore, she wants to increase her income by expanding her dairy business, as there is more demand for milk and dairy products in the nearby towns. Jayanti is planning to buy another cow. Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. She feels that this will add some extra income to her present income.

Jayanti dreams to purchase a plot of land in the future with the profit earned from her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is grateful that she accessed a 20000 PHP loan which she used to pay for additional stock of gift items to sell at her gift shop. Her earnings helped cover their personal, household expenditures and her child's school needs. 

She would like to apply for a 25000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for gift items such as toys, pens, dolls, word puzzles and other supplies like stationary, birthday and other special occasion cards to sell at her gift shop. She is thanking God for the good return on her store and the financial help for it will surely help fund her family's daily sustenance. 

Celia aims to grow her business. She desires to give her high school child a college education to allow her better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies . 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gift items to sell at her small gift shop.

loans.name: Iqlim

texts.en:
Iqlim is a generous woman. She was born in the eastern-north part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is living in a town with her family and is married with four children. Almost three years she has been doing business selling and buying manufactured goods. Her store is situated near her house and it is easy and convenient for her to do business. She has permanent potential customers every day. 

She has a plan to do business in agriculture, because there are good conditions for keeping livestock. She is asking a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders and do efficient business to ensure her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy livestock and run an efficient business to ensure her family's welfare

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old and married with four children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries.

Lolita has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marcelina is 52 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marcelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Marcelina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma, separated, makes a good earning by hog raising in Oroquieta. This is how she supports her family and sending her children to school. She wants to increase her profit, so Thelma approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase an additional two heads of piglets. She has high hopes that she will have more savings to acquire a coconut land for her desired farming project.

loans.use: to purchase an additional two heads of piglets

loans.name: Romano

texts.en:
Romano is known in their neighborhood as being a hard-working father. He is engaged in farming activities as his primary source of income to provide for his family. He became a member of PMPC, and appreciates the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to start repairing his house for a safe and comfortable living. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to start repairing his house for a safe and comfortable living

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Milona

texts.en:
Milona is grateful that she accessed an 50000 PHP loan which she used to pay for personal products of popular local brands to sell directly to consumers. Her earnings helped cover their personal, household needs. 

She would like to apply for another 50000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for direct selling personal products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and beauty products from Avon, Natasha and other popular brands to meet the orders and the increasing demand of her goods. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help for it will surely help support her family's daily sustenance.

Milona aims and prays that God will prosper her direct selling business. She strives to to give her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies . 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business

loans.name: Luchi

texts.en:
Luchi is from Dipolog, she is 28 years old. Luchi is a single mother with two kid and she owns and operates a sari-sari store. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Unfortunately she almost lost her capital when her children got sick. 

PMPC to Luchi is a good fortune where she can gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luchi is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase store inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily owns and manages an internet cafe in Oroquieta City, Philippines. This has been doing well for years, supporting the needs of the family. Recently, she loaned an amount to purchase computer accessories and pay for the maintenance supplies. This will help her to continuously sustaining the needs of the family especially her children's education. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to aspire a new space in the city for the extension of her business.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories and pay for the maintenance supplies

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 52 years old. She is married with 8 children aged between 15 and 25 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 11 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize and pay school fees.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a 40-year-old entrepreneur from the Baganbari village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Together, Dipali and her husband are raising three sons. Her husband Lalit is a vegetable vender, and he sells vegetable in the market. One of their sons is involved in a furniture-making business and their other two sons are students.

Dipali is occupied mostly throughout the day by her household work. She wanted to utilize whatever little time that is left to increase her income to alleviate the family from poverty. This prompted her to start a cattle rearing business. She started her small enterprise by purchasing one cow and she sells milk to her neighbors, who are her main clients. This enterprise is now earning her a fair portion of the family's income. She toils hard every day for her business and family.

Realizing the scope for further development, she decided to buy another cow and expand her business. Dipali seeks a loan from Kiva through BJS for this purpose. This loan will help Dipali to increase her monthly income, which will go a long way in ensuring her family financial security. She dreams to purchase more cultivable land with the profit from her business.

She is very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a milch cow (dairy cow) for her milk supplying business.

loans.name: Dody

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of our agents, Dody. Dody lives in East Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and four children. Dody owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that coming to his stall and he decided to join Ruma last year because he wanted to expand his business through technology. Dody is a friendly and cheerful man and his community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Dody needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can have access to connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Dody’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Dody is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases by members of his local community.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en:
Sojida is a cheerful woman. She was born in the western-north part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. She is living in a town with her family. She is a widow and has one child. In order to feed her family she does business in the domestic market. 

She has her own store where she trades women's underwear. Features of her business is its accessibility and below market price. She brings up her child alone. She is planning to buy a new collection of women's underwear for her store. 

She requested a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy a new collection of women's underwear. She hopes to be supported and have permanent customers.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's underwear

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat is a generous woman. She was born in the northwestern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She lives in a village with her family. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She has ten years of experience keeping livestock for a living. She was taught at a young age how to keep livestock. They lived in a mountainous village and it was convenient to get the forage for livestock. 

She has permanent customers. She sells livestock for meat. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to take a loan to buy livestock and grow her business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling vegetables.

Rosalyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 40 years old and has one child in school.

Emma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emma has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Yayan

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of Ruma’s agents, Yayan. Yayan lives in East Bandung, a suburban area located about three hour's drive from Jakarta. Yayan is happily married, and together with her husband, they have two sons. As a main source of income, Yayan owns and manages a small stall that sells daily consumer products. She feels excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. Her community sees her as a kind and trusted mobile provider, as well as an informative & cheerful person. 

Right now, Yayan has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called 'Mapan'. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Yayan and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 
 
As a Mapan agent, Yayan is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Yayan will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Yayan believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Yayan is the one who is standing and holding Mapan's brochure. She is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to help community members purchasing products through Ruma's e-commerce for lower income communities called Mapan.

loans.name: Jessica Silvana

texts.es: A sus 19 años de edad Silvana es una joven con muchas aspiraciones, Silvana vive en el campo junto sus padres y sus 5 hermanos. Silvana se dedica a  la crianza de animales menores. Silvana recientemente termino un curso de costura al que estaba asistiendo y comenta que por medio de su negocio de los chanchos fue como se pudo ayudar con los gastos que tenia de este curso. Silvana solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Silvana tiene un sueño de incrementar su negocio y que le siga yendo bien en este negocio para mejorarlo y asi mas adelante formar un capital para comprar una maquina de coser con la que pueda emprender un negocio que es el de costura ya que eso es lo que le gustaba desde que era niña.
texts.en: At 19 years old Silvana is a young woman with many aspirations. She lives in the country with her parents and five siblings. She works raising livestock. Silvana recently finished a sewing course and indicates that through the pork business is how she was able to help herself with expenses related to the course.  Silvana is requesting a loan to invest it in buying pigs. Silvana’s dream is to grow her business and continue to do well in it to improve it. This way in the future she will have some capital to buy a sewing machine and start a tailoring business which is what she likes doing since she was a kid.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kamali

texts.en:
Kamali is a 29-year-old entrepreneur from Falakata. She is married and a mother of two sons. Her sons are students in different grades in the local village school. Kamali’s husband Adhir is a cycle-van puller by profession. They live in Harinathpur village in Alipurduar in a small mud house.

Kamali’s husband has a very inconsistent income, which is not adequate to meet all the expenses of a four-member family. Kamali always wanted to extend her helping hands to her husband to run the family well. She decided to contribute to her family by practicing cattle farming and started raising dairy cows. She has been selling milk and other byproducts like cow dung (widely used as farm manure) to her neighbors for the last few years. In this way, she tries to provide supplementary income to her family.

Kamali has been earning a decent income from dairy farming. However, the demand is overwhelming, and she wants to increase her dairy cattle. The biggest challenge is a lack of funds. So, she is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, with which she plans to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow.

Kamali will use the profits from selling milk on her children's education and well-being and to build a concrete house for them. An improved income level will assure her family a secure future. She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her dairy business.

loans.name: Nurhasanah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma agents, Nurhasanah. Nurhasanah lives in South Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her three children. Nurhasanah owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. She feels happy as well because since she joined Ruma, she can gives more contribution to her community. Her community sees Nurhasanah as friendly and informative mobile service provider. 

As the business grows, Nurhasanah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Nurhasanah’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Nurhasanah is the one who is standing in front of her own stall, together with one of of her children. She is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Ingris Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Ingris  Maricela  39  años de edad vive su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una de san Lorenzo, valle  se dedica desde hace cinco años al negocio de elaboración y venta   de utensilios de barro, como adornos de forma tortugas, cusucos, floreros, gallos, cubetas, platos, etc. 
Doña Ingris Maricela la mayoría de sus clientes son los que transitan hacia el Salvador y de regreso los que viajan hacia Tegucigalpa, vende variedad de piezas de artesanía es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación, actualmente ya está asociada a una cooperativa de artesanos donde también expone sus piezas de arte en otras ciudades.
 Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tierra, leña y pintura que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos,  con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y suplir la necesidad de financiamiento. Su sueño es tener un buen taller de artesanía y a si poder emplear a muchas personas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2015.
texts.en:
Señora Ingris Maricela, age 39, lives with her husband in their home in San Lorenzo, Valle.  She has had a business for five years, making and selling useful clay items, such as decorations in the shape of turtles, armadillos, and roosters; vases, trays, plates, etc.

Most of Doña Ingris Maricela’s customers are people travelling to and from El Salvador, and to Tegucigalpa.  She sells a variety of hand crafted pieces. She is a model of hard work and dedication, and she is now a member of an artists’ cooperative, through which she also exhibits her art pieces in other cities.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of earth, firewood, and paint, which are the raw materials for making her products.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and meet the need for financing. Her dream is to have a good crafts workshop, and in this way, be able to employ many people.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2015

loans.use: to purchase earth, firewood, and paint for her business.

loans.name: Runu

texts.en:
Runu is a 39-year-old married woman and is raising two children. She stays in a small kaccha hut (made of mud and straw) in the village Subhash Pally at Alipurduar. She sends her children to school. She has received education up to grade 9 and could not proceed further.

Her husband Shibu runs a small biscuit business to contribute money to the family according to his ability.

She has sewing machine that she uses to stitch shirts, pants, blouses, salwar kamij (Indian suits), etc. and gives financial assistance to her family. She is a very hardworking and talented woman who has been pleasing her clients over the years with her qualified service.

She wishes to buy another sewing machine so that she can earn more money to rise out of the family’s poverty. So, she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a sewing machine so that she can stitch more garments as per her customers’ demand.

Runu dreams to expand her business, and she also has a vision of improving her family’s economic condition. She is confident that she will develop a good business in the years to come and provide further education to her children.

Runu is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to extend her sewing work.

loans.name: Sorth's Group

texts.en: Sorth, 43, is a rice and cassava farmer living in Siem Reap province. She is also a paid worker. She is a mother of six children and has been involved in these businesses for 23 years. She earns about 27,100 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds to do farming, she is now taking a new loan to hire a tractor for cassava farming. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to hire a tractor to support her farming

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.en:
Hilarion is a pensioner and is in need of a loan to buy medicine and to pay for building rentals. He needs support for his health maintenance and he needs money for building rentals.

He hopes to repay all his obligations in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy medicines and to pay for building rentals

loans.name: Dolo

texts.en:
Dolo is 35 years old and a rural married woman who is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). They are studying in school. Her husband is an entrepreneur from a farming family and is involved in agriculture. They live their own kaccha house (straw and mud-made house) in a small village called Dalimpur in the district of Alipurduar.

Dolo works hard every day, from the early morning. Their main activity and source of income is in the planting and cultivation of paddy rice. One of the challenges they come across in the maintenance and support of their crops is the high prices of the farm inputs. Because those items are expensive, the income with which she is left is sometimes too low to help as it should. So, it is difficult to maintain their household expenses.

Dolo has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BJS to purchase seeds of paddy and good quality fertilizers, pesticides, and other necessary farm supplies for farming. She hopes to get a better income from their business with this loan amount. Both Dolo and her husband want to give a proper education to their children.

Her plans are to save a little more, in order to be able to build a concrete house for the family, and she thanks her lenders very much for their help.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali hails from Chuakhola village of Falakata, Alipurduar district in West Bengal. She is a married woman of only 24 years. She has a small family comprising four members: her husband and two daughters. One of her daughters has started going to school; the other is a preschooler. She has received a secondary level education up to grade 9.

Dipali is a homemaker, while her husband runs a home-based business of selling lighters used for gas ovens. Besides this, he also repairs the lighters, fills gas in the lighters, etc. as per the customers’ demand. Dipali assists her husband. They have had trouble accessing financing and so they work door-to-door in the village, and keep the extra goods at their house.

Their monthly income from the existing business is inadequate and hardly meets their household expenses. So, Dipali is requesting a business loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner) to purchase more necessary tools and materials for improving her husband’s business.

With this loan, Dipali will buy more lighters in bulk from the wholesale market and expand the business. Together, she and her husband will be able to increase their savings. In the meantime, she also hopes to use the profits to help her daughters get a good education and become strong, independent women.

Dipali is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more necessary tools and materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna is from Harinathpur village in Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a married woman of 35 years. She has attended school up to grade 5. Jharna has a family of five members, consisting of her husband and one son and two daughters. Two of her children are students. One is a preschooler.

Her husband Sukhadeb is a vegetable vendor. Jharna manages a business of stitching and selling garments in her locality. As she has a sound knowledge of stitching from her childhood, she has chosen this business. She sews cotton garments like shirts, trousers, frocks, blouses, and petticoats for her customers. She and her husband, with their small income, are maintaining their family in a low profile. Now she wants a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a better and modern sewing machine.

She hopes for the expansion of her existing sewing business. With the profit, she hopes to give more education to her children and to compensate the family’s financial hurdles. Her dream is to start a shop of her own tailor-made garments in the future.

Her full thanks go to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Putul

texts.en:
Putul is a 29-year-young rural housewife who lives in the Madhyapara village in Alipurduar. She lives there with her husband and one daughter. Her daughter is in grade 1. Putul has completed her Higher Secondary standard education.

Putul’s husband makes furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables, and wardrobe as per customers' orders. In order to construct the furniture he requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, paint, and good modern tools. So Putul wants to invest money to buy all the required materials for enhancing the carpentry works. The family’s income depends on this business as this is the only income-generating source.

With the intention of improving the business, Putul hopes that a loan will make it possible for her husband to buy good quality wood and required materials to fulfill his customers' orders. So, Putul has asked for a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner).

Putul hopes that the loan amount will allow her to supply the orders on time. She also hopes that this business will generate enough income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead. Her dream is to provide a quality education to her daughter for her future.

Putul is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood and necessary materials for enhancing her family business.

loans.name: Malikabonu

texts.en:
Malikabonu is a cheerful woman. She was born in the west-northern part of Tajikistan into the family of workers. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. She lives in agricultural location and well knows how to do agriculture. She plants vegetables and cereals as corn, rice and barley. She has potential permanent customers for her goods. 

She is planning to dig a well on her land and buy fertilizer to have a good harvest next season. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and dig the well on her land. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and dig a well on her land

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, with 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, maize and other crops and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to do large scale farming within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved livelihood. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to have an improved livelihood

loans.name: Mamuroi

texts.en: Mamuroi is a skillful woman. She was born in the northwestern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in town with her family. She is married and has four children. She has 20 years of experience doing business at the domestic market. She buys and sells shoes. Despite the fact that she lives in an agricultural location, she does business and brings benefits to her family and the budget of family. Her son is sick. She is a careful mother and wants to treat her son in the hospital. She needs to get him abroad to treat him in good medical clinics. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her son abroad in a medical clinic by qualified doctors. She hopes to be supported and have a healthy son.

loans.use: to treat her son abroad in medical clinics by qualified doctors

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, maize and other crops and also keeps cows. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more cows. Her business goal is to be a large scale milk supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale milk production. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon has transferred to her new home in Pagadian. In need of home energy, she applied for a loan for home electrification.

Corazon hopes to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to pay for home electrification.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita is a mother of 3 from Tudela. She earns a living through making copra. She approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase whole coconuts for copra making. She hopes to increase her income by increasing her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase whole coconuts for copra making

loans.name: Roneta

texts.en:
Roneta is a widow from Tudela. She earns a living through snack vending. She bravely raised her four children through selling snacks. She likes to have enough inventories of raw ingredients for her chosen business in time for the school enrollment. 

In the future, Roneta hopes to hire more workers, so that she can mass produce of her snacks and display them for the school canteen.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 50 years old and has five children. She has two children who are in school.

Dolores is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Dolores has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina works hard to support her family. Adelina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Adelina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Adelina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Adelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 32 years old and married with one child. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Judith has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal care products and other groceries.

Evangeline has been in this business for two years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of Ruma’s agents, Eli. Eli lives in South Bandung, a suburb located in West Java about three hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Eli is happily married, and together with her husband, they have two children: one son and one daughter. As a main source of income, Eli owns and manages a small stall selling daily consumer products. She feels excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. Her community sees Eli as an informative mobile provider, as well as a hardworking and friendly person. 

Eli has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower-income communities called 'Mapan'. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Eli and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 
 
As a Mapan agent, Eli is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Eli will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Eli believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Eli is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchase products through Ruma's e-commerce system called Mapan for lower-income communities.

loans.name: Mauro Vinicio

texts.es: Mauro es un señor que vive en una casa pequeñita y humilde, Mauro está casado y tiene 6 hijos en total, 2 son mujeres de las edades de 6 y 19 años y 4 hombres de 10,13 16 y 18 años. De todos sus hijos 5 son los que están estudiando, algunos presencial y los otros a distancia, Mauro se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, Mauro solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la comprar de una vaca. Mauro es un señor muy trabajador y desea que sus hijos se salgan adelante por medio del estudio y asi tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Mauro is a man who lives in a small and humble house. Mauro is married, and he has 6 children: 2 daughters who are 6 and 19 years old and 4 sons who are 10, 13, 16, and 18 years old. Of all his children, 5 are in school, some locally and others at a distance.
