Mauro makes a living in agriculture and raising small animals. Mauro is requesting a loan to buy a cow. Mauro is a very hard-working man who wishes for his children to move forward through their studies so that they can have a good future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy a cow. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a cow to provide a stable income

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman and has 2 children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are individuals.   

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, salt and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, salt and other items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with six children. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, liquor, personal product care and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, liquor, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Tujikaze Arutani Women Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the name of the man raising his hand in the photo, a member of Tujikaze Arutani women group. He is married and a father of six.
His economic activity is poultry keeping. He joined hand in hand eastern Africa in March 2013 and has received training on enterprise management and financial planning. These trainings have equipped him with skills of effectively running his poultry business. 

Patrick requires a loan to purchase quality chicken feed and also buy more chicks. He believes this will increase his proceeds especially egg production and thus boost his income. He will therefore be able to improve the living standards of his family such as better diet and quality education.
Patrick is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed that will increase egg production.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Nancy, 47 years old and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does poultry keeping as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more chicks so that she can increase her income from sales. This will assist her to cater to the family needs such as food and paying school fees for her children. 

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks that will boost productivity and thus more income to cater to the family needs.

loans.name: Asucena Marili

texts.es:
Asucena es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad de Santa Catarina.
Asucena para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de repuesto de motocicletas, ella tiene  un año de tener este pequeño negocio, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también brinda servicios de mototaxi.
Asucena ahora esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar repuestos de mototaxi pues el trasporte que le genera sus ingresos se encuentra en mal estado y ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar todos los repuestos necesarios, para que el mototaxi vuelva a su buen estado.
El gran sueño de Asucena es poder instalar otro negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y construir una casa.
texts.en:
Asucena is a 32 year old woman. She is single and lives with her four children in the community of Santa Catarina.  
To generate income and get her family ahead, Asucena works buying and selling spare parts for motorcycles. She has had this small business for one year, but to improve her income she also provides motorcycle taxi services. 
Asucena is now requesting a loan to be able to buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi. The vehicle that generates her income is in bad condition and she does not have sufficient money to be able to buy the necessary parts so that the motorcycle taxi can be restored to good condition.
Asucena's biggest dream is to be able to set up another business to improve her income and build a house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 55 years old and married with seven children. Epifania works very hard to provide for them.

Epifania runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Epifania has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Epifania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. Corazon is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fish net and other materials for her fishing business.

Corazon has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fish net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Langat. She is 38 years old, married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to gain knowledge and skills on savings, enterprise management and financial management. 

Langat operates a profitable poultry business and thus is borrowing from Kiva to add more chickens and to buy poultry feed. By doing so, her income will increase, and she will be in a position to educate her children to higher levels. Langat is happy and grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the support of her business. She therefore promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and poultry feed to boost yield, and thus more profits to meet family needs.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Mercedes se sigue dedicando al negocio de hospedaje,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un hospedaje mas grande.La socia solicita el credito para comprar camas y sabanas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal Bank member Mercedes continues in the lodging business, and by means of this business, she wants to provide for her family. Her dream is to have a bigger inn. She is requesting the loan to purchase beds and sheets.

She is happy about the loan, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase beds and sheets.

loans.name: Musallam

texts.en:
Musallam is a wise woman. She was born in a northwestern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She is living in a village with her family. She is a widow and has three children. She has 10 years of experience doing business in agriculture. She plants vegetables like potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. and she has a big fruit garden. She has good conditions to do business in her village. She gets a good harvest and income from her business and wants to enlarge in the future. 

She has appealed to Kiva and IMON to take a loan to be treated at hospital. She is sick, and in order to continue her business and feed her family she needs to be treated in hospital and to be healthy. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to be treated in hospital and to be healthy.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a farm where she keeps sheep and cows. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more sheep. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to provide her with a stable income

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely happily raises her pigs in her own backyard. This is how she earns income for her family. Recently, she asked for a loan to buy bags of animal feed. Emely has increased her livestock with additional heads of pigs for added income. She hopes to open a meat shop someday.

loans.use: to buy bags of animal feed

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lolita has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anadelia

texts.en:
Anadelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Anadelia has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase clothing stock to resell such as shorts, t-shirts, etc. 

Anadelia has been in this business for 2 years now. She would like to save enough money to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing stock such as shorts and t-shirts to offer for resale.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 42 years old and married with four children. With all of her children in school, Bonifacia works very hard to provide for them.

Bonifacia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other supplies.

Bonifacia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Bonifacia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products,  and other supplies

loans.name: Marco Vinicio

texts.es: Marco tiene 18 años de edad, hace un año empezó con su negocio que es la crianza de animales menores. Marco vive en el campo con sus padres y sus 5 hermanos. Marco solicita el dinero del crédito  para comprar chanchos ya que su madre le ayuda  a cuidar estos animalitos. Marco asiste al colegio los fines de semana ya quen comenta que sus padres no tiene los recursos ecunomicos para pagar sus estudios y los demás días Marco trabaja al jornal. Marco solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  chanchos ya que con este  negocio es como se ayuda para todo lo que necesita para el colegio y sus demás gastos. Lo que Marco aspira es seguir adelante con sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Marco is 18 years old. A year ago, he started his business, which is raising small animals. Marco lives in the countryside with his parents and his five siblings. Marco is requesting the loan money to buy pigs, because his mother helps him taking care of these little animals. Marco attends school on the weekends, because he comments that his parents do not have the financial resources to pay for his studies, and the rest of the days Marco works as a daily laborer. Marco is requesting the loan money to invest it in buying pigs, because with this business he helps himself with everything he needs for school and his other expenses. What Marco wishes is to move forward with his studies and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Enma Rene

texts.es: Enma se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era muy joven, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, Enma vive con su esposo, su hija y una nieta que está estudiando, Emna para obtener sus ingresos economicos se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Enma juntamente con su hija también se dedica a la confección de ropa, Enma va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en un pequeño lotecito que ella posee, Enma aspira ampliar su negocio y de esta manera salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Enma has worked raising pigs since she was very young. She is married and has 3 adult children. Enma lives with her husband, their daughter and a granddaughter who is attending school. In order to get financial income, Enma works raising small animals. Together with her daughter, Enma also works sewing clothes. Enma will invest the loan to buy pigs in order to have them in a small lot she owns. Enma wants to expand her business, and in this way to move ahead together with her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 110,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. Her business goal is to have a stable farm within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. 

Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia Cornelia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza platos como pollipapas es un plato a base de pollo y papas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar papas y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Cornelia works in the food sales business. She makes dishes such as pollipapas, which is a dish made from chicken and potatoes, and she wants to provide for her family by means of this business. Her dream is to expand her pollipapas business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase products for cooking potatoes and chicken.

She is happy about the loan, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase products for cooking potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Frasiah

texts.en: Frasiah is a married woman. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to do large scale farming within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her livelihood. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nora works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jordin Alexander

texts.es:
El joven Jordin  de 22  años de edad, vive en una  comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva sus clientes son los amigos y personas que le conocen.
Jordin  es un joven trabajador con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas, chores, blusas, camisas, etc. para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor atención espera que esta inversión pueda lograr salir adelante con su familia.
con el apoyo de este préstamo el joven  desea salir adelante es su segundo préstamo que solicita.
 Su sueño es tener su casa y un buen negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Abril del 2015.
texts.en:
Jordin is 22 years old and lives in San Lorenzo, which is in the southern valley of Honduras. For the past two years, he has worked selling new clothing to his friends and others.  Jordan is a hardworking young man with dreams of getting ahead.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, etc. in order to offer better service to his customers.  He hopes that this investment will allow him and his family to get ahead.  With the help of this loan he hopes to get ahead.  This is his second loan.  His dream is to have his own house and a successful business.

San Lorenzo-April, 2015

loans.use: purchase pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, etc. for his business

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a hospitable woman. She was born in the west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a town, is married and has three children. She has 11 year of experience doing business in agriculture keeping and selling livestock. She is a member of a collective farm and gets forage from her land to feed livestock. She keeps and feeds livestock for 10 -15 days and sells in the animal market. She does a good business and gets enough income to ensure her family's welfare. 

She requested a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy livestock and continue her business. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and hopes she will have an efficient business to bring a benefit to the budget of her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and continue her business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a father of six children at the age of 51. As a father, he always wants better for his family. He has been in farming for eight years already and is engaged in a rice production business. 

He aims to increase his income, so that he can be able to provide for his family’s needs. He decided to borrow a loan at GDMPC to purchase fertilizer for his rice field and to enable a good production of rice.  For the future, Reynaldo wants to expand his business for his children’s educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. Cecilia has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband to plow the rice field and to plant corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Cecilia decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 14,900 to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. Cecilia has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is married and has four children. Beatriz is from Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte  She is a diligent and determined mother when it comes to the welfare of her children and even her grandchildren. 

For a living, Beatriz earns by making snacks that she sells herself and also on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. 

Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her children, Beatriz smiles at the thought of completing her house and living a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase production of snacks to sell on consignment

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Linah. She is 37 years old, married and has four children who go to school.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to learn and gain more knowledge on enterprise start up and development.  She also learned skills in financial management, which have helped her manage her finances well.  

Linah does a poultry business, which has enabled her to earn income for her family’s basic needs. She is borrowing a loan to buy poultry feed and to purchase more chickens.  This will increase her income since her poultry will be highly productive, and thus help her meet the daily rising family needs such as food, clothing, and proper education for her children. Linah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feed and chicks that will increase productivity, and thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The person in the above photo is Joseph. He is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. 

Joseph joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to learn and gain skills in saving, enterprise start-up, and financial management. The training helped him to run and operate his farm well.

Joseph is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizers and quality seed. These farm inputs will help boost his crop production and yields which will increase his income. He will be able to provide for his family's needs such as food, better housing, and education for his children. 

Joseph is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seed that will help boost crop production.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 62 years old and a widow from Tudela. She bravely raised her two children on her own by raising pigs in her own backyard. She has leaned on  Paglaum as her financing partner. She borrowed another amount to buy bags of animal feed and vitamins. Lydia hopes to sustain her business, and dreams to open a meat shop in their neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is married with 4 children. She earns a living through her buying and selling business. She buys in bulk inventories of coconuts and resells to the market. She finds it easy doing this kind of business as she only has to count every purchase and makes already good money for the family.
In the future, Rosenda hopes to formally open a display store for her buy and sell business.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of whole coconuts for resale

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 53 años de edad, es casado tiene  una  linda nieta a su cargo de 16 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Diego para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la producción de miel de abeja, esta labor lo realiza el desde hace tres años.
Diego es uno de los pocos hombres que se dedican a la producción de mil en su comunidad, es por ello que esta labor para él es muy rentable, Diego ahora se ve a la necesidad de comprar tablas, laminas, azúcar, cera y estampado, para preparar la producción de la próxima temporada, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para poder realizar la compra por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Diego es poder contar con cien cajas de mil para seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Diego is a 53 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful 16 year old granddaughter under his care. This humble family lives in a community of  Sololá. In order to generate his income and move his family ahead, he works in the production of bee honey. He has worked in this business for three years. Diego is one of the few men who works producing honey in his community, and this is why his job is very profitable for him. Nowadays, Diego sees himself in the need of buying boards, blades, sugar, wax and stamping in order to prepare next season's production, but one of the difficulties he has is that he does not have enough money for purchases. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to be able to cover this need. Diego's greatest dream is to be able to have a hundred boxes of honey to keep improving his income.

loans.use: to buy boards, blades, sugar, wax and stamping.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edilberta is 63 years old.

Edilberta has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Edilberta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Edilberta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production and help her family

loans.name: Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is James. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in the year 2012. James does a farming business. The training he received from HIH EA helped him gain knowledge on enterprise management and how to manage the finances from the enterprise. 

His enterprise is doing well, and therefore he is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and quality seeds. This will increase farm yield, and thus more income. James is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan with ease.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and quality seeds that will boost crop yield.

loans.name: Minto Women Group

texts.en:
Irene, the woman on the left, is one of the two-member group, Minto Women. She is married, has six children and is a dairy farmer. Irene joined Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training for enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her learn how to manage her dairy better.

Irene is applying for a 20,000 KES loan to be split between her and her partner. She will use her portion to buy high-quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production and help Irene keep up with the demand for milk in her area.

Irene hopes to see an increase in her income so she can continue in her support of the family. In the long run this should improve the family’s living standards and lead to better medical care and quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy high-quality fodder for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Bekiki Boda Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Johana, a member of Bekiki boda Youth Group. He is 47 years old, married and a father of 3 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2012.

He does maize and potatoes farming as his main business. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled him in budgeting and record keeping for his business. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seeds. This will assist him to cater for the family and manage his business well.
 
Johana is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to improve farming.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Selina, 42 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
She does dairy, maize and potatoe farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management; this has enabled her improve her skills in budgeting, planning and record keeping. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seeds. This will assist her cater for the family and manage her business well.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost farming thus more proceeds.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y su negocio es la extracción de piedras para construcción.
Ella es emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el rio de la zona ‘Chuquiaguillo’ Ubicado al norte de la ciudad, los vecinos se dedican a trabajar como amas de casa y otras como cocineras o como lavanderas. Todos aquí son personas de bajos recursos económicos. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Rita es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la realiza sola, vive en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la extracción de piedras del rio para construcción. Este es el material de construcción escogido para recubrimientos, delimitación de caminos, terrazas, pasillos, entrecalles, fuentes, cascadas o para cubrir árboles. La extracción de estas piedras se realiza de forma manual, “aprendí la actividad de mis padres, quienes trabajan en extracción de arena conocí a los clientes y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes son continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la renovación de la maquinaria. Su sueño es comprarse un camión arenero, ella desea renovar el motor de su griva (máquina lava arena) para continuar con su trabajo. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Rita solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor para su griva de lavado y con los beneficios comprar un camión arenero.
texts.en:
Rita is a single, childless 21 year old woman who works extracting stones for construction. She is entrepreneurial, cheerful, optimistic, happy, responsible, hardworking and has a great attitude.  She works in a river in the Chuquiaguillo zone in the city's northern region. Her neighbors work as maids, chefs and washerwomen. Everyone in her community is of few means.  The climate is cold and dry, and the temperature varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees celsius.  

Rita is tan, has brown eyes, and long black hair that she ties in the back.  She is short and thin, and her native tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish out in public and for work.  She lives alone, in a rented room made of brick and cement with a metal roof and a wood floor.  She has running water, electricity and a sewer system.  

She works extracting stones from the river to be used for construction.  This material is used for coating, delineating roads, terraces, corridors, fountains, waterfalls, and to cover trees. She extracts these stones by hand. She states "I learned this trade from my parents who work extracting sand. I got to know their clients and I branched out on my own." The upside of her business is that her customers are regular. The downside is a lack of money to repair her machinery. Her dream is to purchase a sand truck. 

She hopes to repair the motor of her sand washing machine in order to continue working. This is her second loan with the institution in her two years of working independently.  For these reasons, Rita is seeking a loan to purchase motor for her washing machine and use her profits to purchase a sand truck.

loans.use: purchase a motor for her sand washing machine and use the profits to purchase a sand truck.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 34 years old and single. She wants to help her parents for a living, that's why she engaged in a rice production from her family rice farm. She aims for a better income so she decided to borrow a loan again to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm so that it will produce a good harvest and have a good production.

Lorelie wants for the future to invest other business out from her savings through her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is married with four children. She helped her husband make income for the family through raising pigs. Currently, she wants to take advantage of the good sales, and that's why she availed another loan to buy two heads of piglets and bags of animal feed. In the future, Rita hopes to see all her children have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy two heads of piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Emwlia

texts.en:
Emwlia is 63 years old, married and has five children. 

Emwlia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emwlia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emwlia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Matunda Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Johana, a member of Matunda Self Help Group. He is 59 years old, married and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

Johana grows maize, beans and potatoes. With the training he received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his crop farming  business and is getting more profits out of it unlike before. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will improve his income hence be in a position to educate his children and provide for the family needs.
 
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Wuendy Paola

texts.es: Wuendy de 20 años, domiciliada en el municipio de Baranoa en el Atlántico, al poseer experiencia en ventas porque que de niña vendió artículos a sus conocidos y amigos, decidió  iniciar su almacén de ropa desde la comodidad de su hogar.  Ella es madre de una niña de un año de edad que necesita de mucho tiempo y cuidado, por eso para ella es más cómodo trabajar desde su casa y poder compartir con su pequeña.  Adecuó un espacio en donde exhibe en vitrinas y maniquís la mercancía; blusas, jeans y faldas, que comercializa entre sus vecinos y amigos a quienes les ofrece precios asequibles y facilidad de pago.  Sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia, es llamada la capital de la moda por ser una de las urbes que más promueve la industria textil y de confección en Colombia y ha logrado disfrutar de un surtido novedoso y a la vanguardia, lo que promueve las ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en pantalones y blusas de nueva colección. Wuendy tiene metas de prosperidad entre ellas comprar una casa y su almacén propio. Su principal desafío darle a sus clientes más ropa a crédito para poder incrementar sus utilidades.
texts.en: Wuendy, 20 years old, works in the municipality of Baranoa in the Atlantic. Having experience in sales because as a child she used to sell items to her acquaintances and friends, she decided to start her clothing store from the comfort of her home. She is the mother of a one year old daughter who needs a lot of time and care. Therefore, for her it is more comfortable to work from her house and be able to share with her small daughter. She adapted some space where she exhibits the merchandise, blouses, jeans and skirts, in showcases and mannequins. She sells these among her neighbors and friends, whom she offers at affordable prices and facilities in payment. She buys in the city of Medellín in the department of Antioquia. It is called the fashion capital for being one of the cities that promotes the most the textile and sewing business in Colombia, and she has been able to enjoy a novel and fashionable assortment which promotes sales. Currently, she is requesting a credikiva, the first loan she does to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in pants and blouses of the new collection. Wuendy has progress goals, among them to buy a house and her own store. Her main challenge is to give her customers more clothes on credit in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in pants and blouses of the new collection.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Jane does not have any academic papers, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Bomet area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married, and together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with a lovely family. For the past 25 years Jane has been involved in mixed farming. Jane has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. 

Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices have been going up in the recent past, so Jane, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will get not only milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Jane said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural-based loans, and their interest rate is both low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Jane hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to add value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her children and aging parents.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow for high yield milk production, which will change her life

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to do large scale farming within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her livelihood. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation Inc. Elizabeth supports her family through her buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Jonel, 20 years old and first of 5 children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and currently in the 3rd of this 4 year course.

Elizabeth is borrowing 15,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Jonel for the First Semester School year 2015-2016.

Jonel plans when he graduate to help her parents earn income to send her brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son who is studying for a BSc in Marine Transportation

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is widow and has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks used clothes like shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothes like shirts, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 53-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Letecia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fisn and other supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is the name of the lady appearing in the photo. She is thirty years old and a mother of one child.

Her economic activity is poultry keeping. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in January 2014 and has received training on enterprise management and financial planning. These trainings have equipped her with skills to effectively run her poultry business. 

Alice requires a loan to purchase quality chicken feeds and buy more chickens. She believes this will increase her proceeds especially egg production and thus boost her income. She will therefore be able to improve the overall living standards such as quality education and better medical care of her family.

Alice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: To buy quality chickens and chicken feed to help boost farming.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 52-year-old woman with six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lydia has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, personal care products, home care products and groceries.

Lydia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, personal care products, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Juratjon

texts.en:
Juratjon is a handsome man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1992. He is living in a rural area where in the spring season a lot of tulips are blooming. He is single and lives with his parents.  The standard of living in the rural area is not good. 

Juratjon as an exemplary son helps his parents to earn the family budget. He retails flour from city to this area. He has a car with which he drives to customers houses and sells the flour. Recently, the crisis influenced the budget of the population and they cannot buy flour. 

Juratjon as a kind, human and generous person helps and supports his residents and lends flour. He requested a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy flour and do business. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy flour and do business

loans.name: Rispar

texts.en:
Rispar is 48 years old, married to Joseph and she supports a family of 6 members.
 
She has been a dairy farmer for the last 12 years and earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet the demand of clients.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet the demand of clients

loans.name: Gurgonia

texts.en:
Gurgonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, oil, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Gurgonia has been in this business for 10 years. Gurgonia earns more income from buy and sell vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Gurgonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is a married mother of 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 28 years old, and she has 1 child currently in school.

Era has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fish and other supplies for selling fish.

Era has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other supplies for selling fish.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and has five children. Helen is married and has one child in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Helen has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 42-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a general store business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, candies, bread, and eggs. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Lourdes has been in this business for 16 years.  In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, candies, bread, and eggs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 58 years old now.

Lolita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies for fish vending.

Lolita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and other supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 years old and has three children. Lydia is a married woman.

Lydia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lydia has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for the improvement of the family lifestyle

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 58 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as coffee, chips, bread, canned goods, etc.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income as a fishpond operator.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as coffee, chips, bread, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Chanthea's Group

texts.en:
Chanthea is 23 years old and a mother of a small child living in Steung Treng Province. 

Grocery selling and soy bean farming have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. She could earn about 16,400 KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Chanthea is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more grocery items to sell. 

Chanthea hopes to earn more income and improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Arcylel

texts.en:
Arcylel is 26 years of age, married and has one child. She owns and manages a small computer shop within their community. She has been operating this business for almost two years. She aims to continue and improve this business but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy video cards and other computer parts and accessories needed in her computer shop. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business more.

loans.use: to buy video cards and other computer parts and accessories

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Her name is Julieta, who is 51 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, a driver, and they have four children of whom one is in high school. Two stay at home and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income, support their daily personal and household needs, and send her child to school.

Julieta would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan, which she will use to pay for the tricycle maintenance of her vehicle and partly to pay for ingredients needed for her food vending. 

She is thanking God for the safe trips, good turnout at her food vending and the financial help, for it will surely help fund her family's everyday personal and household needs. 

Juleita aims and prays to God that her transportation business will prosper and that all of its trips will be safe. She desires to give her family a good life. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies . 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for his tricycle maintenance and for ingredients needed on her food vending as well.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Sonia has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs in his field of graphics and network design.

loans.name: Mamazuhur

texts.en:
Mamazuhur is a capable, goal-oriented and hardworking man. He was born in northern Tajikistan in 1968. He lives in a village with his wife and four children where he farms vegetables and keeps livestock.

Mamazuhur must work hard to feed his family. His daughter is sick and needs medical treatment every six months. His mother is old and needs medication every day. Life is difficult for the family.

Mamazuhur is applying for a 2,000 TJS loan through Kiva's field partner IMON International to buy necessary medication for his mother and daughter. With the vegetables and cereals he has planted this year he looks forward to a good harvest in order to pay off this loan. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy necessary medication for his mother and daughter.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Thon is aged 29 years old, and is a mother of two children, living in Steung Treng province.

Cassava and soybean farming have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. She could earn about 34,400KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pesticide for her farming. She hopes to gain more yields than last year and improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticide

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Ma. Melinda

texts.en:
Ma. Melinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Melinda is 55 years old now.

Ma. Melinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Melinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies for her business.

Ma. Melinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish  and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a 35-year-old rural woman who lives in Itkhola, a small village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is the mother of one son who studies in college. Jhunu has attended school up to grade six.

Her husband is associated with bag business and is the guardian of the family.  He is responsible to fulfill the needs of all the family members. Jhunu has been running her own beauty parlor and she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household expenses. Currently she needs to buy different types of good quality cosmetics and other modern accessories for her beauty parlor to attract more customers, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Thus Jhunu has applied for a loan through BJS (Kiva’s partner). 

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business, so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. Jhunu hopes she would be able to make savings for her family to lead a secured life.

For this financial assistance, Jhunu is very grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To buy different types of good quality cosmetics and other modern accessories for her beauty parlour.

loans.name: Enh's Group

texts.en: Enh is aged 38 years old, and is a mother of five children, living in Kratie province. Cassava farming and working for other farmers have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. She could earn about 93,300KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay plowing fees. She hopes to gain more yields than last year and improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.en:
Maria Vilma is 45 years old from Lazi, Siquijor in the Philippines. 

Maria Vilma is married and has a motorcycle transport business. She has loyal passengers in their neighborhood and arranges for their transport to and from the town proper. This is how she earns a good income for her family. 

Recently, Maria Vilma has taken a loan to pay for motorcycle maintenance and licenses. She hopes to sustain her business and would like to purchase another motorcycle unit for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and licenses.

loans.name: Sampa

texts.en:
Sampa is a thriving and hardworking woman in Arabindu Nagar village in Alipurduar. She has a secondary grade (Madhyamik) education. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter) and has been raising them with great effort and dedication. They are in grades four and one, respectively.

Her husband Alok, 37 years old, is a small businessman in betel nuts by profession. His income is quite unsatisfactory, thus he is unable to meet all the demands of his family.  So to help her husband, Sampa, for the last few years, has been providing a sewing service by making clothing such as blouses, petticoats, salwar suits, frocks and many other items at customer’s request. She works alone all day to generate more income to help her husband with the economic burden of supplying household resources.

Sampa wants to continue working hard to expand her sewing work and generate more income to ensure economic stability and give her family a better quality of life. So she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a sewing machine for stitching more garments to satisfy her customers. 

With this loan, she intends to expand her sewing work to remove the financial burden from her family and educate her children properly. Her dream is to get ahead with the business smoothly and buy a more modernized sewing machine in future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for enhancing her sewing business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 34 years old with one child. Ma. Theresa works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, dried fish, charcoal, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, dried fish, charcoal, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is based in Maua, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married to Protasio, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one lovely child. 

Rael is a mother dedicated to her work. At age 30, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, on her mixed farm, working tirelessly. Rael is one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on Planet Earth. 

For the past six years she has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. 

Although Rael makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Rael comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity." Rael faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health. 

Rael is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Rael wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan, she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. 

With your loan, Rael will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. Rael is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. 

She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Rael’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items, fish, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy hails from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 25 years old with four young children. Her eldest is six and her youngest is only six months. 

Mary Joy works hard on her farm even while looking after the needs of her small children. Her farming business started five years ago. Each month she usually earns a profit of 2,000 PHP from her hard work. 

Mary Joy is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer, and to pay for people working on the farm. Any profit will go towards food for her family, providing needs for her baby, and paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer, and to pay for people working on the farm

loans.name: Chepkiripseet Kotes Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Agnes, a member of Chepkiripseet Kotes Group. Agnes is 48 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. 

She farms maize and beans. She has gained skills in enterprise start-up development and financial management, which has helped her manage her finances well.  

She is taking this loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. This will enable her to increase her yields, hence improving her income. This will allow her to continue to educate her children.
 
Agnes is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost crop yield.

loans.name: Cyclin

texts.en:
Cyclin is a widow and the hardworking mother to her children. She is a businesswoman who always considers the welfare of her family. 

In need of additional capital, she approached Paglaum. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional heads of piglets to raise. 

Cyclin hopes to construct a bigger space for her pig pen to accommodate more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a 40-year-old rural housewife. She lives in a small village in Falakata. Anjali has a big family comprising her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Her children are students. She attended school until grade eight and could not study further due to her family’s financial problems.

Anjali’s husband has been engaged in a fish vending business. He buys fish from village fishermen and sells to the local market.  Unfortunately, his income is not sufficient to maintain his family of five members with sufficient surplus. So, Anjali can hardly materialize her dreams. To get more income by expanding her husband's business, she applied for a loan from BJS, Kiva's partner. This will enable him to purchase a huge quantity of fish and related items. 

She hopes to get more and more profit from the expansion of her business, save money for the construction of a concrete house, and purchase a 'Toto' (a battery-operated auto rickshaw) to rent it to others for another means of income.

Anjali is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of fish for her family business.

loans.name: Protima

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Protima is from Madhyapara village in Alipurduar. She lives there with her 59-year-old husband and one son. Protima is illiterate but can sign her name. 

She, being a hardworking lady, helps her husband in running the grocery shop, after managing her household works. Their son also helps them in their business. They sell food items like spices, rice, pulses, sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs, biscuits etc. and daily essential commodities. Now Protima wants to increase her stock of items to satisfy the demand of her daily customers as there are many other grocery shops nearby. Thus, Protima is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery shop so that they can please all her valuable customers and neighbors as well.

With the expansion of the business, she hopes to have a better income, which will help her to develop the financial condition of her family. She wants to save the profit for her family’s well-being and to increase the stock of various grocery items in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Shashibala

texts.en:
Shashibala is a woman of 46 years. She lives with her husband and one son in a small village in Alipurduar.  She and her husband both are Illiterate, and can only sign their names.  Due to their poverty, their only son could not receive an education and works as a driver.

Shashibala's husband has been running a business selling tea. Every morning Shashibala makes tea, which her husband carries in a pot to the local railway station.  His main customers are the train passengers and passersby. He also has a small tea stall far away from his house. This small business is the main source of income for the family, which hardly covers even the food expenses. So, the family is in an acute financial crisis. He purchases stock for his business from the wholesalers.  Due to the lack of sufficient money, he has to purchase items on a regular basis, which unnecessarily increases costs in both finance and labor.  Now Shashibala and her husband want to increase their stock of their tea-making products such as tea leaves, sugar, milk and other items to increase their productivity for more income. But their main challenge is capital.

Hearing from her rural neighbors about BJS (Kiva’s partner), Shashibala took a loan to purchase the required items for their tea-selling business. Shashibala hopes this will help to increase her family's income for materializing her dreams of constructing a better tea stall in the future.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for her husband's business of selling tea.

loans.name: Agustin Gonzalo

texts.es: Agustín es un joven ecuatoriano nacido en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en el cantón Pujilí un rincón rural del hermoso Ecuador que se caracteriza porque la gente se dedica a la ganadería que les ayuda a sustentar a sus familias. Él está felizmente casado con María con quien tiene una hermosa hija. Es un joven emprendedor con muchos sueños que su único objetivo el saca adelante a su familia y darles una vida digna. Se dedica a la elaboración de bloques por esta razón solicita su crédito para la compra de maquinaria que le ayudara a incrementar su producción y por ende ayudara a los ingresos de su hogar. Agustín agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños y mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustín is an young Ecuadorian born in the province of Cotopaxi in the Canton Pujili in a rural corner of Ecuador.  The area is characterized by people who labor as cattle ranchers which provides the sustenance for their families. 
Agustin is happily married to Maria with whom he has a beautiful daughter.  He's an entrepreneurial young man with many dreams but his main goal is to get ahead his family and give them a decent life.  He works making blocks for construction and he's requesting a loan to buy equipment that will help him increase his production and thus the income in his household.
Agustin is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for helping him achieve his dreams and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to continue his business making blocks for construction and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 61 años, está divorciado, vive en casa familiar tiene hijos pero están todos casados y viven lejos de él, Luis vive en un sector donde la mayoría de personas se dedican al comercio y también al turismo de la ciudad como son la laguna de Yahuarcocha.
Luis tiene su negocio de servicio de taxi ofrece viajes largos y cortos el ha venido realizando esta actividad desde hace 13 años atrás, el negocio ha sido su sustento del día a día, el ha tenido problemas en su relación y tuvo que separarse de su pareja a pesar de eso sigue en la lucha para poder solventar todas las necesidades que le vienen cada día, con su taxi demuestra responsabilidad y puntualidad en todo momento es respetuoso con las personas y muy atento a la hora de brindar su servicio de taxi.
Con el crédito que solicita va reparar el vehículo que es herramienta fundamental de su negocio va comprar repuestos y así poder seguir ofreciendo su servicio a más gente de la ciudad.
Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le brindan a seguir adelante en todo los sueños y metas que tienen las personas.
texts.en:
Luis is 61 years old, divorced, and lives in a family home.  He has children but they are all married and live far from him.  Luis lives in an area where most people work in commerce or city tourism thanks to places like Yahuarcocha lagoon.  
He's had a taxi service business for 13 years offering short and long trips which provides his sustenance day after day.  He had problems in his relationship and had to split up from his partner.  In spite of that he keeps fighting day after day to take care of all his daily needs.  With his taxi he demonstrates responsibility, punctuality, respectfulness and treats his clients very well.  
With the loan he will buy spare parts to fix his vehicle which is his main business tool and thus keep offering his service to more people in the city.  He's grateful to Fundacion Alternativa for the support provided so that he can get ahead and achieve all his dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix his vehicle which is his main business tool.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de cocos tiene 5 años de experiencia en las ventas con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor y así tener mejor ingreso económico para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young man whose face has been pixelated is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has earned his living selling coconuts for five years. With the money he earns from sales he manages to pay for some household expenses. He lives in his own house with his three children. He is seeking a loan to buy coconuts in bulk so he can have a greater income and a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy coconuts in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sweet breads

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Victoria is 54 years old now.

Maria Victoria has a dried-fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies for dried-fish vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, Maria Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other supplies for dried-fish vending

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El muchacho Luis Enrique nació en Jinotega en el año de 1982. El solamente logró terminar su primaria y en los tiempos de vacaciones Luis le ayudaba a sus padres a labores de agricultura así fue que poco a poco se fue relacionando con las labores de campo. Actualmente esta casado y tiene un hijo.El tiene una propiedad en la que tiene sembrado café además siembra granos básicos. En esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y en los tiempos de la temporada de corte de café se levantan bien temprano para hacer la comida para los cortadores y se tiene que alumbrar con foco y en la noche se tiene que alumbrar también con foco cuando están despulpando. y cuando tiene que ver al niño por las noches para atenderlo también tiene que estar alumbrándose con foco o candela.Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder hacer las cosas con mejor comodidad, Luis comenta que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comprar sus cosas y que el panel es otro bien que el compraría y que le será de gran utilidad para la casa y trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique was born in Jinotega in 1982.  He only finished primary school and during his vacation time he helped his parents in agriculture which is how he learned about working the fields.  He's married and has a son.  He has a property in which he grows coffee and basic grains.  In his community there's no electricity so in the coffee picking season they wake up very early to make the food for the pickers and they have to use lanterns and flashlights to be able to see and at night while they are taking out the coffee pulp it's the same situation as well as when he has to go take care of his kid at night.  
This is why he's requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system so that they can work and take care of their daily chores more comfortably.  Luis mentions that he's been able to buy his things with a lot of effort and the solar panel will be another one of those articles that will be of great help for his home and for work.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: Loem is a villager living in Kandal province. She is 59 years old and a mother of three children. She has been involved in a rice-farming business for more than five years. Because her farm is a bit far from home, she wants to buy a motorbike to support her business. She hopes to improve her family’s lifestyle and make it easy to get to her field.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Kahuruko Women Group (B)

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand holding a passbook is Margaret. She is 28 years old, married and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

She practices dairy farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds to increase milk production and hence earn more income. This will enable her to meet her family's basic needs at ease. 

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds to increase milk production and hence earn more income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente nació en un lugar llamado Tapasle en el año de 1975 . A los 7 años de edad empezó a estudiar  primaria pero poco después dejo de ir a clases ya que para ese tiempo estaba la guerra civil y los padres decían que era muy peligroso fue por eso que los padres decidieron no enviarlo más a clases. Así fue que Vicente se dedico a trabajar en labores de agricultura con el padre.Actualmente Vicente y sus hermanos se dedican a trabajar en la propiedad que dejo su papa y cosechan café,cacao y siembran granos básicos también. Comenta Vicente que gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron a ser una buena persona trabajadora y ganarse las cosas con honestidad trabaja bien con personas de la comunidad y los organismos que visitan la zona. En la comunidad donde el vive no hay luz eléctrica y el quisiera solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y comenta que este sistema solar seria de gran beneficio para todos los miembros del hogar ya que tiene sobrinos que están estudiando y por las noches le serviría para alumbrarse y hacer algunas tareas que le dejan de clase, además en la temporada de corte de café se levantan por las madrugadas a hacer la comida para los cortadores y se tiene que estar alumbrando con candelas o focos y por las tardes y las noches hacen la tarea de despulpado y también se tiene que alumbrar con foco, pero ya teniendo el sistemas solar se podrán alumbrar de otra mejor manera y poder hacer con más facilidad las cosas, este bien que se obtendría seria un bien mas como medio de trabajo en la propiedad y don Vicente estaría muy agradecido si le dan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
