Sr. Vicente was born in a place called Tapasle in 1975. When he was 7 years old, he started primary school but a short time later, he had to stop as it was the time of the civil war. His parents decided it was very dangerous so they stopped sending him to school. Instead he started work in the fields with his father. Nowadays he and his siblings work the land that was left to them by their father. They grow coffee, cocoa, and basic grains.

Vicente notes that it was his parents who taught him to be a good, hardworking and honest person. He works well with his neighbors and the organizations who visit the area. 

In his community there is no electricity so Vicente is seeking a loan to buy a solar system. It would bring many benefits to all members of the household; he has nieces and nephews who attend school and need light at night so they can do their homework. As well, during the coffee harvest the family has to get up early and make food for the workers. At the moment they use candles and flashlights when they have to work in the dark extracting the beans. With a solar system they would have a better source of light in which to complete their tasks more easily.

Sr. Vicente would be very grateful to be given this opportunity to buy a solar system.

loans.use: To buy a solar system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and improvised farm implements for use in her farm for a better harvest so as to meet family and client needs.

loans.name: Alman

texts.en: Alman is 47 years old and married, and has two children. They are 13 and 11 years old and go to school. Alman’s wife keeps the home. The family lives in the Baku region of Azerbaijan, but for 23 years they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the city of Fuzuli. Alman owns a store where he sells different types of seasonal fruits and vegetables. He wants to buy more products to sell to develop his business. For this reason he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). In the future he wants to help pay for his children’s education. He says great thanks to Kiva and its lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and increase his business.

loans.name: Mamurboi

texts.en:
Mamurboi is a hard-working man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married and has five children. He is a goal-oriented, responsible, and careful father. He wishes to ensure his children get an education and to feed them well.

The standard of their living is bad. Mamurboi has many year of experience doing business in agriculture. Unfortunately, all his saved-up money was spent on agriculture, and now he has no money to feed his family and to treat his sick wife. He appealed to IMON asking for help to get a loan so that he can treat his wife and provide for family needs like clothing and food. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to treat his sick wife and provide for family needs like clothing and food.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is known to be a responsible and hard-working father to his kids. At the age of 51, he has made good sales on fish-selling activities. Recently, he availed a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy kilos of fish in bulk for resale. Edgar knows that having enough inventory means good income. In the future, Edgar wants to purchase a motorized pump boat for fishing activities.

loans.use: to buy kilos of fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 22-year-old woman with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Mary, 63 years old and a mother of four children. She does maize and beans farming and also sells water in her neighborhood.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2014. She is grateful to HiH EA for enterprise training and inculcating in her a culture of saving.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She hopes to satisfy customers' demand for eggs and white chicken meat so that she can earn more income from her poultry enterprise. Through the income, she will cater for her family needs such as food and education for her children, and she will save for the future.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed that will improve eggs and chicken meat production (hence, more income to cater for family needs).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: A 45-year-old mother of two children, Phat lives in the Kampong Cham province. She has been a corn farmer for 27 years, and it earns her about 42,500 KHR per day. Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to get a Kiva loan via VisionFund, with her loan portion used to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Miguelou

texts.en:
Miguelou is a married 50-year-old woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Miguelou has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Miguelou has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is a retired employee and a pensioner. She proceeded with a project for renovating her house in Maria, Siquijor. Because of a lack of finances, she availed a loan to buy housing materials like plywood, sticks, and nails. Eulalia hopes to live comfortably with her children.

loans.use: to buy housing materials like plywood, sticks, and nails.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en: Nem is 49 years old and a mother of three children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming has been the only source of her family’s income for more than five years. She can earn about 34,700 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain more yields than last year and have enough equipment to use.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee una barbería y sala de belleza tiene 11 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para comprar productos (talcos, shampoo, cremas, acondicionadores, etc.) y herramientas que utiliza en su trabajo y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes y tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en:
Samuel, 39, lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  He has a barber shop and beauty salon, and 11 years' experience.  His business is set up in his home and he uses his income to cover some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy products (talcum powders, shampoo, creams, hair conditioners, etc.) and equipment for his work in an effort to provide better customer service and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy products (talcum powders, shampoo, creams, hair conditioner, etc.) and equipment.

loans.name: Rhuel

texts.en:
Rhuel is grateful that he was granted a 27,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase raw materials to make stoves and rugs for sale. With his earnings he is able to send his child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

He would now like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan that he will use to buy more materials to manufacture stoves and to sew rugs to sell. His earnings from his rug- and stove-making is a stable source of income to sustain his family's basic needs and to educate his child in elementary  school. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him. 

Rhuel aims to grow his business so he can build his own house. He wants give his child a college education to give him better opportunities in life. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to manufacture more stoves and  make rugs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Julian Alejandro

texts.es: Julián es un joven ecuatoriano nacido en la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, esta provincia fue considerada como tal hace tres años. Tiene 24 años, vive felizmente en unión libre sin hijos. Vive en un sector rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi conocida como Cuilche Miño, en este sector la mayoría de personas se dedica a la agricultura lo que les ayuda a sustentar a su familia. Él solicita su crédito para emprender la venta de pescado verde y yuca, productos naturales propio de la ciudad en donde nació lo que le ayudara su futuro ya que él conoce mucho de ese tipo de negocios. Por otro lado se puede destacar que a pesar de su corta edad es emprendedor y trabajador  que lucha por salir adelante ante tantas barreras pero siempre pensando en él y su pareja. Julián agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a KIVA por hacer posible mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Julian is a young man from Ecuador who was born in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas which became a province three years ago.  He is 24 and lives happily with his partner.  They have no children and live in the rural province of Cotopaxi, known as Cuilche Miñoa.  In this area most people work in agriculture to support their families.

Julian is requesting a loan to start a fish and yucca plant business.  These are natural products from his birth city and will help him in the future because he is very familiar with this type of product.  He wants to point out that despite his young age he is an entrepreneur and hard worker who struggles to overcome any obstacle in his way, always thinking of his partner and himself.  Julian is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and KIVA for making it possible for him to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To start a fish and vegetable business for a promising future.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 35 years old with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Noemi is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise livestock. Noemi has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Misakwani Small Farmers Group

texts.en:
Rose is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo. She is a member of Misakwani Small Farmers Group. She is 33 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat, and other household items. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs to add stock to her general retail shop for increased income to meet her family's expenses.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to add stock to her general retail shop

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is from Larena. She is 64 years old and does a living through buy and sell of dry goods and other merchandise. 

She is on her way of renovating her house and has availed a loan to pay for labor cost on house renovation.
In the future, Lea hopes to purchase a parcel of land for her gardening activities.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost on house renovation

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children ages seven and eleven. Her husband works in a construction while she spends her time working in her rice farm. Both are not easy jobs for they are under the heat of the sun, but they persevere so that their children can go to school. 

Milagros is asking for a 7000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. She hope to see better profits from her business with the help of an additional capital.  Her income will be for her children's schooling and healthy meals for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Wilma has been in this business for 4 year now, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and buy and selling dressed chicken.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 37 years old and married. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Miwani Jua Kali Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Stella, a member of Miwani jua kali women Group. She is forty nine years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She practices mixed farming where she grows maize and beans and also keeps poultry. Stella is taking a Kiva loan to buy chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicines for her poultry business.  This will enable her boost production of eggs and chicken for increased income to pay for her children's school fees and food. 

Stella is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicks, chicken feeds and chicken medicines for her poultry business to boost production of eggs and chicken for increased income to pay for school fees and food.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Joyce, a 44-year-old youthful mum. She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Joyce passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 10 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her parents and family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

The main challenge that Joyce faces is that her cows stray to her neighbour's compound. This has been causing many losses to her, because she has to compensate for the damages caused by the animals. She is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire. Through the loan she will be able to control her animals, and this will help her a great deal. She will save more money. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy barbed wire to prevent her cattle from straying and causing damage

loans.name: Chathy's Group

texts.en:
A 45-year-old mother of three children and two of them are in school, while the other one is too young to attend school, living in Kampong Cham province. She has been a rice farmer and grocery seller for twenty seven years and it earns her about 45,000KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming. She hopes to earn more income and have enough equipment for her family’s uses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos 3, 5 y 7 años y un bebe de 7 meses, y su negocio es la venta de frutas por mayor. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El Torno’ caracterizado por el comercio de productos agrícolas como, frutas, verduras, carne, etc., al por mayor y en grandes cantidades, donde acuden los distribuidores mayoristas a comprar por camionada las frutas y verduras que después repartirán por toda la ciudad. De clima sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centigrados.
Sonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y debido al comercio en la ciudad (al centro, viste calza roja y blusa azul). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja en agricultura y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, los 3 menores aún no se encuentran ene dad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de refrescos hervidos, venta de helados artesanales, venta de pollo frito, preparación de tierra para la siembra, venta de yuca, comercio de semillas y venta de alimento para animales de granja, para solicita un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de frutas de temporada por mayor, los productores del campo llegan hasta su lugar de venta a entregarle grandes cantidades de frutas que ella almacena y vende al por mayor. “inicié mi negocio vendiendo mi propia producción, luego me hicieron pedidos y el negocio se fue estabilizando…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la venta es por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para aumentar la oferta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio elaborando ‘mermeladas de papaya’, ella piensa que será un negocio próspero porque sus clientes le exigen el producto y antes de producir ya cuenta con varios pedidos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la fabricación de mermelada de papaya para incursionar en el rubro y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old and lives with her partner and four children, ages 3, 5, 7 and 7-months.  Her business is selling fruit wholesale.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, consistent, determined, responsible and very hard-working.  Her business is set up in "El Torno" which is known for its commerce of farm products such as fruit, vegetables, meet, etc. wholesale and in bulk.  Wholesale dealers buy fruit and vegetables by the truck-load which they deliver throughout the entire city.  The climate is sub-tropical with an average temperature of between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Sonia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair which she wears tied back, is short in height and has a slim physique.  Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks locally and she speaks Spanish for general purposes and because of the commerce in the city.  (She is the one in the middle wearing red pants and a blue blouse).  She lives with her partner who works in agriculture and their children.  The eldest attends school and the youngest three are not old enough yet.  They live in their own brick and concrete house which has a metal sheeting roof and dirt floor.  It has electricity and well water, but there is no sewage system.

The need to expand her business is what motivated her to set up a bank group that includes activities such as soft drink sales, artisan ice creams, fried chicken, land preparation for planting, yucca sales, seed sales and animal feed sales to request a loan and improve members' businesses.

Sonia's business is selling seasonal fruit wholesale.  Farmers deliver large quantities of fruit to her which she stores and sells wholesale.  "I started out selling my own production and then I took orders and the business started stabilizing..." she says.  The advantage of her business is that she sells wholesale.  The disadvantage is the lack of money to increase her stock.  Her dream is to grow her business by making "papaya jam".  She believes it would be a good business because there is a high demand for the product, so she already has several orders.  This is her first loan through the institution in the two years she has been in business.  Sonia is requesting the loan to get started in the papapa jam business and fill pending orders.

loans.use: To make papaya jam to fill pending orders.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a businesswoman and proud mother to her children who are now entering college. In need of financial assistance on the upcoming enrollment, she applied a loan. Edna has high hopes to see all her children finish their their studies and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs for technical skills to be able to work in the NGO field

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn works hard to support her family. She is single with two children and has a auto repair shop business in the Philippines.

Judilyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and maintenance for her business.

Judilyn has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina, posee 8 años de experiencia en las ventas, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, hoja de huerta, pollo, verduras, etc. por mayor para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Dinora lives in her own house with her husband and four children.  She sells chicken tamales and has eight years' experience in the business.  She works as a street vendor in the different communities near her home and uses her income to cover some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, husks, chicken, vegetables, etc., wholesale, to continue her work since it is her only source of income.

loans.use: To buy corn, husks, chicken, vegetables, etc., wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her tea farming activity so as to raise more income and improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, soaps, seasonings, breads, eggs, noodles, beverages and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 26 years old and married. Charita works very hard to provide for them.

Charita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Charita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beverages, junk foods, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Charita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is single with one child and has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Ruth requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from E-loading station.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stove and food: rice, meats, vegetables and natural flavors, as well as renovate the customer bathoom.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sylvia is 51 years old now.

Sylvia has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish and other supplies for her business.

Sylvia has been in this business for 37 years. In the future, Sylvia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lao's Group

texts.en: Lao, 43, is a father of four children, living in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming is the only source of his family’s income for twenty years and he could earn about 42,500KHR per day. Due to the depreciated rice price in previous year, his family is now facing with a problem of having not enough fund to do the farm, so he forms as a small group to apply for a loan via VisionFund. As a group’s leader, he will use his loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. He hopes to earn more money and have enough consumption to use.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sadrach

texts.en:
Sadrach is 54 years old. He is married and they live in Oroquieta, Philippines.  Sadrach is managing his fishing business and owns a fishing boat.  Sadrach has employed fishermen to work with. He personally sells the catch from his fishing boat to the market and neighboring towns. He earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of his family, especially his children's education. 

He has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul; and purchase fishing equipment and accessories. In the future, Sadrach hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand his fishing business and be able to build a new house for his family.

loans.use: to restock liters of diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul and purchase fishing equipment and accessories

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 62 years old, residing at Maular, Aloran. Magdalena is married and she joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services. Recently, she has accessed a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of textile and foam supplies that she sells in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of textile and foam supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover education costs in technical and software skills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat to satisfy the market demand.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer digna de admiración pues gracias a su esfuerzo de día a día ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ella ahora está muy agradecido  porque gracias al crédito anterior ella pudo surtir mejor su tienda y brindarle una mejor atención a los clientes, con ello también mejoraron sus ingresos, pero ella ahora nuevamente solicita un préstamo para poder realizar una nueva inversión en su tienda comprando productos como arroz, aceite, frijol, golosinas y refrescos.
El gran sueño de Elena es construir una casa de block para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a woman worthy of respect because thanks to her hard work every day she has been able to raise her family.

She is very grateful because thanks to the last loan she was able to stock her store and offer a better service to her customers. This led to an increase in profits.

This is why she is asking for another loan so she can make a new investment in her store by buying products such as rice, beans, sweets and soft drinks.

The ultimate dream is to build a home for her children.

loans.use: to buy general groceries to sell to the public.

loans.name: Jose Bernardino

texts.es: Don Jose de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijas, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, también trabaja por horas en una funeraria, posee 1 años de experiencia, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa de segunda mano por mayor y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with his wife and daughters. He has been making a living selling second-hand clothing for one year. He also works in a funeral home.

José sells the clothing as a street vendor in the areas near to his home. He uses profits to look after his family. José is applying for a loan in order to buy more second-hand clothing in bulk, increase his income and have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Ideal Group

texts.es: 3 mujeres emprendedoras y con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, conforman el grupo “Ideal”. Coordinado por Thania, una joven luchadora de 25 años, soltera, se dedica al bordado de ropa típica nicaragüense, desde hace cinco años.  Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en productos como tela, hilo y elástico.  Con esto producirá en mayor cantidad y obtendrá mayores ganancias.  Sus otras integrantes son Telma, una señora de 67 años, dedicada a la venta de frutas y verduras; Irene, 45 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica en el mercado municipal y capitalino del país.
texts.en: Three entrepreneurial women who are eager to work very hard and get ahead make up the group “Ideal.” It is coordinated by Thania, a determined person who is 25 years old, single, and has worked in embroidering traditional clothing from Nicaragua for five years. She asks for the loan to invest in products such as fabric, thread, and elastic. With this, she will produce a larger quantity and obtain more profits. The other members are Telma, a 67-year-old woman, who works in the sale of fruit and vegetables; and Irene, who is 45 years old and works in the sale of traditional clothing in the municipal market in the capital of the country.

loans.use: to invest in products such as fabric, thread, and elastic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and to purchase materials to lay a floor.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Santa Catarina L Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 30 años d edad es casada vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.
Antonia (es la quinta del lado izquierdo de blusa celeste) con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, desde hace seis años.
Antonia  desde hace algún tiempo ha pensado en mejorar más su negocio, pero no le ha sido posible, por tal razón organizo a un grupo de personas para juntos unir fuerzas y solicitar un préstamos para poder invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa típicas, y ofrecerle a los clientes una mejor servicio.
El gran sueño de Antonia es poder instalar un local en el mercado de Santo Tomas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family in a community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. Antonia (fifth from the left with a blue shirt), with the eagerness to generate an income and help her family get ahead, has worked in the sale of traditional clothing for six years. For a time, Antonia has thought about improving her business, but it has not been possible. For this reason, she organized a group of people so that together they can join forces and ask for a loan to be able to invest in their business of purchase and sale of traditional clothing, and offer a better service to clients.
Antonia’s dream is to be able to open a shop in the market of Santo Tomas.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Maria Edilma

texts.es:
María Edilma es una mujer de 59 años de edad, ella siempre ha sido una mujer de hogar, hace un poco tiempo paso por un periodo muy difícil en su vida que fue la separación con su esposo, ella le preocupaba mucho esta situación puesto que no tiene hijos, quedó soltera, no tenía trabajo, pero no se derrumbó, demostró la persona que es y logro montar un negocio de confección y hoy en día esta maravillosa mujer cuneta con tres empleados.
Ahora esta mujer trabaja pro la sostenibilidad de su nueva familia que es su grupo de trabajo, por salir juntas adelante y tratar de agrandar más su familia.
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hilos en grandes cantidades y variedad de colores, este préstamo le permitirá tener un abastecimiento de insumos lo suficiente para trabajar por un periodo largo de tiempo.
Su principal sueño es salir adelante, progresar y tener trabajo por un largo tiempo.
texts.en:
María Edilma is 59 years old. She has always been a housewife, recently she had a difficult time in her life when she separated from her husband. She was very worried by this situation as she does not have children. She was alone and did not have a job, but she did not break down, she showed the person that she is and managed to start a clothes making business and is now a wonderful woman with three employees. She now works for the sustainability of her new family who are her work group, to get ahead in life together and to try to expand her family.
She is asking for a loan to buy threads in big quantities and in a variety of colours. This loan will allow her to have a stock of supplies which is sufficient to work for a long period of time.  
Her main dream is to get ahead in life, to progress and to have work for a long time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for clothes making, mainly thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as meat, chicken, seafood, vegetables, fruits, basic grains, soft drinks, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Sandra Bilena

texts.es:
En el año 2013 inicio el sueño de una empresaria llamada Sandra que con algunos insumos, un local y un uniforme de trabajo arranco su negocio de salón de belleza, queriendo siempre tener un spa de belleza, que es su gran sueño y por el cual trabaja diariamente, este empresaria trabaja 10 horas diarias se capacito en una escuela de belleza y adquirió experiencia trabajando en salones de belleza.

Sandra sigue batallando diariamente con los pocos insumos y enseres que tiene a la mano, no es la mejor manera de trabajar pero con su prepuesto es todo lo que pueda hacer.
Sandra encontró otra alternativa para solventar su necesidad de comprar activos fijos, enseres, artículos para su salón de belleza, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de enseres de peluquería, un sofá, televisor, un mini-componente y productos de cuidado capilar, todo pensando en ofrecer una mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In 2013, the dream of a businesswoman called Sandra began. With a few supplies, premises and a work uniform she started her beauty salon business while always wanting to have a beauty spa which is her big dream and what she works for everyday. She works 10 hours a day and she trained in a  beauty school and gained experience working in beauty salons.

Sandra continues to fight everyday with her few supplies and her tools in hand. It is not the best way to work but with her budget it is all that she can do.
Sandra found an alternative to pay for her needs and to buy fixed assets, tools and products for her beauty salon. She wants to apply for a loan to buy hairdressing tools, a sofa, a television, a music player and hair care products, all while thinking about offering a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools, a sofa, a television, a music player and hair care products, all while thinking about offering a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer de 47 años de edad, soltera que no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres, los cuales, cuida, protege y mantiene, ella tiene una tienda de bebidas alcohólicas, cervezas y refrescos, gracias a estos ingresos, puede pagar las necesidades básicas de un hogar, pero se siente agotada, cansada de producir siempre lo mismo, solo produce lo suficiente para vivir y es algo que quiere cambiar, peor para lo cual necesita capital.
Luz Marina ha presentado aumento en la demanda de productos, por ello quiere lanzarse a invertir en surtir su negocio con mayor cantidad de bebidas como aguardiente, Ron y principalmente cervezas, este préstamo le permitirá a una empresaria tener mayor unidades disponibles para mejorar sus ventas y así permitirse soñar y creer que su sueño de tener una vida más digna y mayores comodidades es posible.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 47 year old woman. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents, whom she cares for, protects, and supports. She has a store where she sells alcoholic beverages, beer and other beverages. Thanks to this income, she can pay for the basic household necessities, but she feels exhausted, tires of always producing the same thing. It is something she wants to change, but to do so she needs capital.

Luz Marina has had an increase in demand for her products. That is why she wants to invest in stocking her business with a larger quantity of beverages, such as sugar cane liquor, rum and mainly beer. This loan will allow an entrepreneur to have more units available to improve sales and thus allow her to dream and grow, and believe that her dream of having a more dignified and comfortable life is possible.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of rum, beer and sugar cane liquor.

loans.name: Yarline Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yarline es una madre amorosa, comprometida, preocupada que quiere ver a sus hijos, estudiando, tener una buena calidad de vida en su casa y un mejor mercado de alimentos para su nevera, ella que siempre estuvo en el hogar tomo la decisión de salir a vender mercancía, se encuentra distribuyendo aretes, amigos, familiares, personas de barrio, almacenes del sector son sus principales clientes.
Su buen gusto para elegir aretes, han llevado a que esta empresaria tenga buen movimiento de ventas y quiere aprovechar este buen momento para tratar de captar un buen Publico objetivo, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de aretes en cantidades, tu ayuda será muy significativa porque con tu aporte una madre de hogar se podrá convertir en una empresaria.
texts.en:
Yarline is a loving, dedicated and caring mother who wants to see her children get an education, have a good quality of life at home, and have better food in her refrigerator. She was always at home and then she made the decision to go out and sell merchandise. She distributes earrings. Friends, relatives, people in the neighborhood, and area stores are her main customers.

Her good taste in earrings has led to this businesswoman having good sales. She wants to take advantage of this time to try to capture her target customers. That is why she wants to ask for a loan to buy inventory of earrings in large quantities. Your help will be very significant because it could help a mother become a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of earrings to sell in stores.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollo de engorde posee 5 años de experiencia en la actividad con la cual ha podido salir adelante, comercializa sus pollos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado por mayor para continuar con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Esperanza is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter. She has raised broiler chickens for 5 years. She has experience in this activity, with which she has been able to get ahead. She sells her chickens in the different markets close to her house. She is asking for a loan to buy more chickens and concentrate wholesale to continue raising them and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and concentrate wholesale.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар, 45 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 15 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Дилбар, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 1 корова. Также есть земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА, где Дилбар выращивает кукурузу и рис. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Дилбар и ее семьи составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на обработку почвы для выращивания органической кукурузы. Дилбар намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что позволит ей накопить средства на развитие ее бизнеса и постройку теплиц.
texts.en: Dilbar is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education. She has been growing crops and rearing animals as her family's main income for 15 years. Thanks to her perseverance, ambition and hard work, today Dilbar has a cow, and she also has a two hectare plot of land where she grows corn and rice. Dilbar and her family's gross monthly income is about 8,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to cultivate her plot of land to grow organic corn. Dilbar intends to increase the number of her livestock, which will allow her to save up to develop her business and build greenhouses.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and grow organic corn.

loans.name: Jenny Margine

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven de veintisiete años de edad, muy fuerte y luchadora, su madre desde pequeña le enseño a trabajar duro para salir adelante en la vida, en la actualidad posee una tienda donde oferta ropa, zapatos y accesorios usados. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo, madre y hermana, mantiene siempre su negocio lo más surtido posible para su clientela. 
En la actualidad, Jenny, quiere que su negocio crezca más,  es por eso que ha recurrido a Kiva Junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permita comprar un lote de ropa usada. Surtir su tienda con nueva mercadería captara la atención de nueva clientela. En un futuro ella desea ofrecer también ropa nueva, también planea ahorrar para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young woman, twenty-six years old, very strong and determined. Since she was little, her mother taught her to work hard to get ahead in life, and now she has a store where she sells used clothing, shoes and accessories. Thanks to the support of her husband, mother, and sister, she always keeps her business as stocked as possible for her customers. 

Currently, Jenny wants her business to grow more. For this, she has come to Kiva and MiCrédito so they can grant her a loan that will allow her to purchase a bundle of used clothing. Stocking her store with new merchandise will capture the attention of new customers. In the future, she wants to also sell new clothing, she also plans to save up to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Patma

texts.ru: Патма, 41 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. Патма в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 15 лет занимается торговлей парфюмерными изделиями, в обороте есть товар на сумму 400,000 сом (KGS), ежемесячная прибыль до 30,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Патма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Патма планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Patma is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Patma has traded perfumes for fifteen years as the main source of income for her family. She has goods worth 400,000 som (KGS) in stock, and her monthly profit is up to 30,000 som (KGS). Having come to the conclusion that this business is profitable, Patma has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy goods to increase her range. Patma plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in further increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to increase her stock.

loans.name: Deymer Manuel

texts.es:
Deymer es un hombre comprometido, trabajador, responsable, alegre, que vive en un hogar con su pareja y dos hijas, la mayor de 8 y la pequeña de 5, este hombre ama a su familia, hace todo lo posible porque tenga una buena calidad de vida.
Deymer tiene una carnicera distribuye carne de res y de cerdo principalmente, le dedica a su trabajo la extenuante jornada de 12 horas diarias ya que con esto puede generar capital no solo para mantenerse, sino para mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de su hogar.
Debido a las restricciones y por pedido de los clientes Deymer quiere actualizar su equipo, cumpliendo las normas de sanidad, como por ejemplo uniforme, botas, guantes, básculas digitales, enfriadoras, entre otros productos.
Pensando mucho en las peticiones de los clientes y la presión que ejercen las entidades, deymer tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de estos productos y surtido de carne de cerdo y res.
texts.en:
Deymer is a committed, hard-working, responsible, happy man who lives in his home with his partner and two daughters, the older one is 8 and the little one is 5. This man loves his family and does everything possible so that they have a good quality of life. 

Deymer has a butcher shop where he primarily sells beef and pork. He works at his job for a strenuous 12 hours each day since with this he can generate capital, not only to support himself, but also to improve his household's quality of life a bit. 

Due to the restrictions and the requests of the customers, Deymer wants to update his equipment, complying with the health code, for example a uniform, boots, gloves, digital scales, coolers, and other products. 

Thinking a lot of his customers' request and he pressure that the entities exert, Deymer decided to ask for a loan which he wants to invest in purchasing these products and an assortment of pork and beef.

loans.use: to purchase a uniform, boots, gloves, digital scales, coolers, and an assortment of pork and beef.

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es: Sonia de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda donde comercializa productos de consumo diario, tiene 7 años de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes y gracias a las ventas que realiza es como puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, huevos, jugos, azúcar, café, sopas, etc. por mayor y así tener mejor ingreso económico y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Sonia, 49 years old, lives in a house she owns with her family. She has a store where she sells everyday items. She has had this business for 7 years, which is located in her home. She has many customers and, thanks to the sales she makes, she can take care of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase basic grains, eggs, juice, sugar, coffee, soups, etc. in bulk and in this way to have more income and give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, eggs, juice, sugar, coffee, soups, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Divinas”, conformado por 3 mujeres que ayudan al crecimiento económico del país. Dirigido por su coordinadora Martha, de 39 años, viuda y madre de 2 hijos, quienes son su motor de vida, se dedica a la comercialización de zapatos, con el crédito que ella solicita lo invertirá en su taller y comprara suelas, pega amarilla, forro, pegua blanca, hebillas, cueros y hormas. Así crecerá la producción de su microempresa, y cubrirá la demanda de sus clientes. 
Las demás integrantes son Petrona de 55 años, dedicada a la venta de verduras y frutas, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de melón, pina, tamarindo, aguacate. Francisca  de 51 años, comerciante de verdura, y desea comprar granadilla, papaya y sandias.
texts.en:
The "Las Divinas" group is made up of 3 woman who help the economic growth of the country. It is led by the coordinator, Martha, 39 years old, a widow and mother of 2 children, who are the driving force of her life. She works selling shoes; with the loan that she requests, she will invest in her shop and will purchase soles, yellow adhesive, lining, white adhesive, buckles, leather and molds. In this way her micro-enterprise's production will increase and will meet her customer's demand. 

The other members are Petrona, 55 years old, who works selling vegetables and fruits -- the loan will be invested in the purchase of melon, pineapple, tamarind, and avocado -- and Francisca, 51, a vegetable saleswoman and she wants to purchase passion fruit, papaya and watermelon.

loans.use: to invest in her shop and she will purchase soles, yellow adhesive, lining, white adhesive, buckles, leather and molds.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Don Edilberto nació en la comarca de la pavona arriba en el año de 1969. El no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar  ya que no habían escuelas en ese lugar y trabajaba en agricultura con el padre comenta que desde muy temprano en su vida empezó a trabajar en labores de agricultura y en los cortes de café, pero le agradece a la vida que aprendió ya que él vive de la agricultura y tiene su propiedad con café y también trabaja con sus hijos. En el tiempo que se dio la guerra lo reclutaron para cumplir el servicio militar estuvo por un periodo de un año luego salió de ahí y siempre sigue trabajando en labores de agricultura. A los 20 años de edad conoció a su actual esposa, con ella ha procreado 6 hijos de los cuales los menores 2 están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad .Don Edilberto se dedica a labores de agricultura cosecha café y siembra granos básicos. En esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y actualmente usa foco para alumbrarse y don Edilberto quisiera si le dan la oportunidad de un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación y servirá de mucho a todos los miembros del hogar.
texts.en: Edilberto was born in the La Pavona Arriba region in the year 1969. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school since there weren't any schools in this place and he worked in agriculture with his father. He says that from very early in his life, he began to work in agriculture tasks and cutting coffee, but that he is grateful for the life he learned since he lives from agriculture and has his property with coffee and also works with his children. When the war happened, he was recruited to fulfill the military service. He was there for a period of a year and later left from there and always continued working in agriculture. At the age of 20 he met his wife, and with her has had 6 children, of whom the youngest 2 are students at the community school. Edilberto works in agriculture, harvesting coffee and growing basic grains. In this community there isn't any electricity and currently he uses a flashlight to light things. Edilberto would like to have the opportunity to get a loan to purchase a solar-powered electric system which will be installed in the house and will serve all the members of his household well.

loans.use: to purchase a solar-powered electric system.

loans.name: Blanca Hayde

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 61 años de edad vive sola en casa propia, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollo y también posee un molino de nixtamal, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 12 años, comercializa sus pollos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado todo por mayor y así tener mejor ingreso económico para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 61 years old, lives alone in a house she owns. She works raising chickens and also has a corn mill. She has worked in this business for the past 12 years. She sells the chickens in the areas near where she lives. With what she gets from her earnings, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase more chickens and concentrated feed, all in bulk, and in this way, have more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and concentrated feed, all in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  posee una panadería en donde vende pan francés y pan dulce, posee 3 años de experiencia esta actividad la cual la aprendió de su padre y de sus estudios de panadería, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el joven vive en casa propia con su padre, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, jaleas, moldes, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y asi poderle ayudar a su padre con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated because he is 20 years old and lives in an area of high risk, has a bakery where he sells French bread and sweet bread. He has 3 years of experience in this work, which he learned from his father and his bakery courses. His business is located in his home. The young man lives in a house he owns with his father. He is asking for a loan to purchase flour, jellies, molds, etc. to continue with his work and in this way be able to help his father with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase flour, jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is 31 years old and married. She is from Oroquieta. For over the past two years, Selly has owned and operated a retail store where she sells assorted goods to the local community. Selly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Selly is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional store inventory and provide working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодату  46 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Саодат развелась мужем. Сыну 20 лет, а дочке 24 года. Сын находится  на заработках загранице,  потому что он уже взрослый, и решил быть самостоятельным и помочь маме обеспечить семью. Дочка свободное время помогает маме.  Саодат добрая и гостеприимная женщина. Она около 5 лет занимается земледелием.
   В этом году Саодат посадила помидоры. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожая. На данный момент Саодату надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения. Но на такое количество удобрений ей не хватает не большая сумма денег. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Саодат верит в Вас и Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Saodat is 46 years old. She is the mother of two children. Saodat is divorced from her husband. Her son is 20 years old, and her daughter is 24. Her son works abroad because he is already grown up and decided to be independent and to help his mother provide for the family. Her daughter helps her mother in her free time. Saodat is a kind and hospitable woman. She has been growing crops for about five years.

This year Saodat planted tomatoes. Just a little time remains until harvest. At the moment Saodat needs to cultivate the crop with artificial fertilizer. She plans to get a high quality and rich harvest, and so she wants to buy a high quality, proven fertilizer. But she lacks a small part of the money she needs to buy such an amount of fertilizer. She is asking for a loan to buy artificial fertilizer. Saodat believes in you and in your kindness.

loans.use: to buy high quality artificial fertilizer.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es padre de 2 hijos. Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 35 años. 

El aprendió este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de observación de otras personas. El y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos. 

Mario sueña terminar con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. 

¡Impacte la vida de Mario y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Mario is the father of two children. He's dedicated to his family, and to his work in agriculture which he's done for 35 years. 

He learned farming empirically, watching others at work. He and his family live in a rural zone of Colombia where there is no easy access to financial services such as those offered by Interactuar.

With the loan, he will buy agricultural inputs including seeds, pest control products, and compost, to prepare his crops.

Thanks to this loan, Mario and his family will enjoy a better household economy and quality of life, as he earns better income. He dreams of improving his home. With your loan, you will be making a difference in their life!

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, pest control products, and compost to prepare his crops.

loans.name: Gabriela De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Gabriela, tiene 30 años es madre soltera, el hijo tiene 2 años, vive en casa arrendada en la Parroquia de Eugenio Espejo que pertenece a la ciudad de Otavalo, por el sector la gente se dedica a la agricultura y también a la elaboración de artesanías por ejemplo collares, pulseras, manillas en materia de tagua además ofrecen turismo como la laguna de San Pablo, el Lechero y el parque Cóndor.
Gabriela tiene su taller de maquilado que bolsas, mochilas, estuches para celulares y otros esta actividad lo vine realizando desde hace años atrás, el taller le ha servido mucho porque es su fuente de ingreso para todas las necesidades que le viene al mes y también para ayudar a su hijo en todo lo que necesita  gracias a la iniciativa personal que tuvo al emprender este negocio hoy en día es una persona empresaria que maneja sola el negocio  y sin el apoyo del padre del hijo ella lucha por brindar todo lo mejor en su hogar.
Con el crédito que solicito lo va invertir en la compra de una maquina overlock para seguir brindando más servicios en su taller y así incrementar más clientes por que con la máquina que va adquirir va realizar otro tipo de servicio que le hace falta en el taller.Gabriela agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 30 years old, a single mother, and her son is 2 years old. She lives in a rented house in Eugenio Espejo parish, which is part of the city of Otavalo, in this sector, the people work in agriculture and also in making crafts such as necklaces, bracelets, and bracelets made from ivory palm. In addition, they have tourism such as San Pablo lake, el Lechero and Cóndor Park.

Gabriela has a workshop where she assembles bags, backpacks, cell phone holders and more. She began doing this work years ago. The shop has served her a lot because it is her source of income for all the needs that arise during the month and also to help her son with everything that he needs. Thanks to her own initiative that she had to undertake this business, today she is an entrepreneur who runs her business alone and without the help of her son's father. She struggles to have the best of everything in her home. 

With the loan that she requested, she will invest in an overlock machine to continue offering more services in her shop and int his way increase her customers because, with the machine that she will get, she will do another type of service that is lacking in her shop. Gabriela is grateful to Kiva for the offered support.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine and continue assembling with quality.

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is heading into the next cropping season. He wants to prepare for the season well, especially much-needed land and seedbed preparations. 

Bienvenido is requesting a loan from the Cooperative to buy a good supply of rice fertilizer and herbicide and to purchase a new knapsack sprayer. In the future, he hopes to save enough money to purchase a rice thresher to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and a new knapsack sprayer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Elías, tiene 44 años, no tiene hijos viven en casa arrendada desde hace 8 años atrás en el sector de Andrade Marín que pertenece a Antonio Ante lugar donde la gente se dedica a las confecciones de prendas de vestir y también al turismo como la fábrica Imbabura, además tiene tradiciones como platos típicos como las fritadas con tostado.
Elías, tiene su taller de confecciones de ropas térmica desde hace años atrás, en el mismo taller también brinda servicio de maquilado de prendas de vestir para diferentes personas que llegan a pedir el servicio de su taller, no tiene hijos menores que este manteniendo, el a diario trabaja en su taller para solventar todas las necesidades que le vienen al mes, tiene una empleada que le ayuda en el taller que también ha demostrado ser una persona responsable al momento de ayudarle a Elías en su negocio los dos están luchando para seguir adelante y así hacer crecer más al taller.
Con el crédito que solicita en Fundación Alternativa lo va invertir en la compra de tela térmica por rollos para seguir elaborando más prendas térmicas y seguir ofreciendo en distintas ciudades de la provincia. Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le brinda con el capital para fortalecer más el taller.
texts.en:
Elías is 44 years old and doesn't have children. He has lived in a rented house for the past 8 years in the Andrade Marín sector which is part of Antonio Ante. This place is where the people work making clothing and also in tourism, such as the Imbabura factory, In addition, they have traditions such as typical meals such as fritadas con tostado [fried meat with toasted corn kernels].

Elías has had his shop making thermal clothing for some years. In the same shop, he also offers the service of assembling clothing for different people who come to request this service of his shop. He doesn't have any young children that he is supporting, He works daily in his shop to take care of all the needs that come up each month. He has an employee who helps him in the shop and also has shown herself to be a responsible person in helping Elías in his business. The two are working hard to continue onward and in this way grow the shop more. 

With the loan that he requests from Fundación Alternativa, he will invest in the purchase of thermal fabric by the roll to continue making more thermal clothing and continue selling it in different cities in the province. He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the help it offers with the capital to strengthen his shop more.

loans.use: to purchase thermal fabric and make clothing; he hopes in the future to grow the shop.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael, a widow, has a small coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines. He earns a good income every quarter to help him survive. To generate additional earnings, Rafael wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. He makes it a point to prepare his land well to have maximum yield and a good income. 

Rafael is requesting a loan from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to pay for clearing and plowing of land and to prepare it to plant seedlings. In the future, he wishes to have more produce to be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing of land and to prepare it to plant seedlings

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. Cecilia is now engaged in a good lumber business, particularly mahogany and acacia mangium wood. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month. Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.

Cecilia is requesting a loan to purchase additional board feet of mahogany and acacia mangium wood to be processed into lumber for resale. In the future, she hopes to establish her own mini-saw mill business.

loans.use: to purchase mahogany and acacia mangium wood to process into lumber

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар женщина 35 лет, замужем, молодая мать четверых детей. Она родилась в малоимущей семье и с ранних лет приучена к труду. Закончив 9 классов средней школы, Дилбар устроилась помощницей продавщицы в магазин. Дилбар так и не смогла поступить в высшее учебное заведение из-за недостатка финансов. В 17 лет ее выдали замуж. Когда у них появился третий ребенок, Дилбар поняла, что должна начать работать, потому что зарплаты мужа не хватало на всю семью. Дилбар открыла свой магазин, где начала торговать продуктами. Сейчас у нее хороший стабильный бизнес, есть постоянные клиенты. В настоящее время Дилбар хочет расширить свой бизнес, закупить новые продукты. Но у нее нет полной суммы денег для осуществления своего плана. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Дилбар надеется на помощь и поддержку со стороны МДО Арванд и благодарит за сотрудничество.
texts.en: Dilbar is a 35-year-old woman. She is married and the young mother of four children. She was born into an impoverished family and accustomed to work from an early age. Having completed nine years of secondary schooling, Dilbar found work as a sales assistant in a store. Dilbar was not able to enroll in a higher education institution due to a lack of finances. She got married when she was 17 years old. When they had a third child, Dilbar realized that she must start working because her husband's wages were not enough for the whole family. Dilbar opened her own store where she started selling groceries. Now she has a good, stable business with regular clients. Dilbar now wants to expand her business and buy new goods. But she does not have all the money to carry out her plan. She has therefore applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Dilbar hopes for help and support from MDO Arvand and is grateful for its cooperation.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 7 años, comercializa los pollos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollo para continuar con la crianza y así poder tener mejor ingreso económico para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and his child. 

He has been breeding chickens which he fattens for seven years. He sells the chickens in the surrounding areas where he lives. With the profits he obtains he can pay for some of the household expenses that come up. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy more chickens in order to continue raising them so he can have better income and more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Bani

texts.en:
Bani, 33, is a rural woman and mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is from the village Sobhagunj in Alipurduar. Her children are students of grade 8. She studied till grade 10, and after that she was married. She is married to Gopal, who is 41 years old.

Bani is an optimistic entrepreneur. With the growing needs of her family and the increasing educational expenses of her children, she started her business to give financial support to her family. She sells clothing like saris, frocks, ladies' attire and men’s garments from her house with the help of her husband. (Saris are garments traditionally worn by the women of India.) 

Now she is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris and other garments from the wholesale market to meet the demands of her valuable customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers.

She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and her plans are to use the profit of her business for the betterment of her family and to provide further education to her children.

She hopes to flourish in her clothing business in future.

She thanks her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of various garments for her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Rinki

texts.en:
Rinki is a young entrepreneur from Falakata. She is 19 years old and married. She lives in a small village in Falakata with her husband. She has completed her secondary education.   

Rinki's husband has been engaged with a small business of sacks for a few years. Her husband buys different kinds of sacks from the wholesale market and sells them in the local market shops, but his meager income does not provide the family with a decent lifestyle and he is facing difficulties to cover all the family expenses. 

Rinki, being a housewife, does some sewing work from her home to contribute in her family. She also stitches the sacks properly to sell them in local markets as well as in her neighborhood. So Rinki decided to invest in her husband’s business in order to provide more to her family. 
 
She knows that there is a great demand for her sacks in the market. She is determined to succeed despite of the many challenges, and the greatest of them she is facing is capital to expand the business. So she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase sacks in bulk from the wholesale market so that she can sell them locally to overcome their problems. 

She hopes the loan will enable her to reach her goal to build a secured lifestyle in the future.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase sacks in a bulk for her existing family business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 36 years old, residing at Sta Filomena, Dipolog City. Ester is married and she joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services. 

Recently, she has accessed a new loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital for her existing business. She will buy a variety of commodities and food products that she sells in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities and food products that she sells.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 60 years old, married and lives at SWP, Calamba, Philippines. 

In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now she requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional feed. 

She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, 69 years old, is married with five adult-children and resident of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than a decade. Egg vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC last June 2012. 

Recently, Pacita decided to apply for a loan to buy additional feed for her poultry business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for expansion of her poultry.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for poultry

loans.name: Sibiah

texts.en:
Sibiah 54 years old is married to William and supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to lead a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 38 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Ellen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, biscuits, beverages, canned goods, candies, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elorgina

texts.en:
Elorgina is 26 years old and married with two children. Elorgina works very hard to provide for them.

Elorgina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Elorgina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as condiments, beverages, coffee, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Elorgina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ema works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Ema is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ema has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, a persevering and diligent mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. 

She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money, so she can complete her house and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is responsible and dedicated in her work as a utility and messenger in their barangay. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life. This work has enabled her to survive. 

Richel became an active member of PMPC and applied for a loan in order to gain funding for her chosen business. She will buy five piglets and build concrete pig pens to start her piggery business. This will allow her generate more income and be able to improve and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and build concrete pig pens to start her piggery business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, who is 59 years old, lives in Santa Filomena, Dipolog City with her husband. She has seven children. Her husband is a carpenter. 

In order to help the family, she has found ways to attain income through food and snack vending. Since she wants to earn more, Marilyn joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received two previous loans already. 

Now, she applies for 12,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her food and snack vending. 

She hopes that her business will continue, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her food and snack vending

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 48 years old and married and living in Bunawan, Calamba, Philippines.  Their child is in the first year of college.  

Their source of income comes from their sari-sari (mini-grocery) store and carenderia (small restaurant). He manages the store & his wife is the chief cook.
